item.name: 221B Baker Street: Sherlock Holmes' Master Detective Game
item.originalname: 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game
item.comment: Limited replayability.
Terrific filler with enough grab and bite to make playing it take some thought.

The temptation to lower the rating aside, this is more than just a game, it is a game system with multiple ways to put everything together to make so many games. I rate it a 10 for its audacity, its hubris, and its accomplishment. The games I have played thus far have been interesting and engaging and different. A fantastic technical and ludotorical (not really a word) accomplishment.

1830's PA is probably my favorite map for 5 players (it plays well with 4 also). Tough, expensive, and with so many ways to screw each other over, it is just fabulous. A great map, and it looks exceptional as well.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment:
Played 5 times in one weekend when I first got it. What an amazing game. I was fascinated by the interactions of the cards, the new opportunities that presented themselves in each game, and the way the whole game played. A gaming masterpiece that any fan of meaty games will enjoy.
[q]- What do you like the most about Agricola?[/q] The game combines a strategic plan with tactical choices very well. It offers immense replayability and you must react to your opponents plays, and their perceived strategy at all times to do well. It rewards good planning and deep involvement. All this while having a fun, different theme, and cute little animeeples.
[q]- Do you think you'll be playing much more of it in the future?[/q] I expect to be playing this for some time, though my plays of it have recently tapered off. I hope they pick up again soon as i devote less of my gaming time to playtesting Dominion.
[q]- Why do you think this game is so replayable? In other words, what keeps you from getting bored with it after so many plays?[/q] The sheer variety of possible hands, and the adjustment to your overall strategy that each hand will require makes each play slightly different.

item.name: Alhambra: De Gunst van de Vizier
item.comment:
I like two of the four expansions a lot, and two of them are merely OK. Call it, 2 tens and 2 sixes that average out to the 8 I give it.
Here is a quick summary of my thoughts on each expansion:
Vizier (My least favorite): Each player has 4 markers they can activate out of turn to buy a single building for exact price. Reactivating a marker is an action.
Exchange House (My favorite): There are a number of cards in the deck which show 2 currencies and a double headed arrow. Playing this card with either currency allows you to use it as the other one depicted. There is one card for each possible exchange. These cards are randomly shuffled in the deck, and flipped over just like money, and are taken just like money is. They must be taken alone, when taken (like a high-value money card).
Building Huts (Good): There are a number of hut stacks kept near the purchasing board. The topmost tile of each stack is revealed. Players may take a hut as an action. Huts are in building colors, and have walls. Each player may take at most 2 (or is it three) huts over the game. Huts count as a number of buildings of the color they are equal to the number of buildings of that color that they border (thus, each is worth 1, 2, or 3) buildings. They can also be used very strategically to enhance your walls (my favorite use for them).
Bonus Cards (OK): Each player gets a number (2 IIRC) of cards depicting specific tiles (the wall-less tiles of each color are in the deck). If they add that building to their Alhambra, they may reveal the card and have the card count as an extra building of that color.

item.name: Alhambra: Power of the Sultan
item.comment: A good set of expansions overall, though nothing stands out as a favorite.

item.name: Alhambra: The City Gates
item.comment:
I like all four of the expansions but none are great.
Here is a quick summary of my thoughts on each expansion:
City Gates: Cards are added to the deck that let you build a double wall then put a gate on it so that the just placed tile can still be reached by walking to the start tile.
Diamonds: Adds 11 diamond cards which can be used as any currency you wish, but only by itself (not in combination with other cards).
Camps: Allows you to score points for long lines of consecutive buildings.
Characters: Adds 10 cards, each with a person who gives a special power to the player who gains that person.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment:
Knizia is such a prolific designer that it is hard to describe a game as "one of Knizia's finest", yet that is often how I feel about Amun-Re.
In this game the key mechanism that is repeated throughout, in multiple places and ways is the payment of money in forced steps: 1, 3, 6, 10, 15, etc. Each raised bid costs exponentially more than what the current bidder has to pay that it makes it a tough propisition to properly evaluate the value of a property.
Then you move to buying resources. There are three kinds: Cards, Farmers, and Stones. Each of them cost more and more the more of them you buy. Again, it makes evaluating your purchases difficult, as you want to make sure your investments payoff in money or victory points. Deliciously tense money management.
Finally, there is the blind-bidding for extra resources, known as the offering. You have a choice here: Steal money and lose a resource, offer just one gold and get one resource, or offer more and try for 2 or 3 resources. It gets very difficult to determine the optimal offering as you have to try to guess what each opponent will do and how that will affect what you should offer. Finally, the mechanism of rewarding the farmers (and on scoring rounds, the temples) based on the value of the total offering, can really throw those calculations out of whack.
There is so much going on that the game could have become a brain-burner, but there never seems to be a problem with that in the games I am in. All-in-all, the intricately interlocking mechanisms and the wonderful tension in spending your money carefully makes this one of my favorite games.

item.name: Ave Caesar
item.comment: I spent obscenely for this. I love this game. Has a very high screwage factor, and is wonderfully engaging.

item.name: Backgammon
item.comment: Play a lot with the wife. The game has more strategy and less luck than it is usually given credit for.

item.name: The Badger Deck
item.comment: Rated based on artwork and usefulness as a game system.

item.name: The Badger Rainbow Deck
item.comment: Rated based on artwork and usefulness as a game system.

item.name: Balderdash
item.comment: I have learned to like certain party games. This is one of them. There are not many party games that get played in my normal game groups (Wits and Wagers is definitely the major exception, along with Coyote), but I enjoy playing Balderdash whenever possible, which seems to be at conventions only. Stephen Glenn should be on the list of mandatory components for this game.

item.name: Balloon Cup
item.comment: One of the best of Kosmos' 2-player card games. And that really is saying a lot, as the whole line is excellent. Oviously, the potential "lock up" problem doesn't bother me.

item.name: Baltimore & Ohio
item.comment: Very similar to 18xx, but with some changes thrown in, just to make it unique. I really like the train mechanism, and found the whole game tense and enjoyable.

item.name: Baltimore and Ohio
item.comment: Very similar to 18xx, but with some changes thrown in, just to make it unique. I really like the train mechanism, and found the whole game tense and enjoyable.

item.name: Bamboleo
item.comment:
I really enjoy dexterity games, and this one is a lot of fun. Balancing the plate can be trick at first, but it gets easier with practice. Well worth the rather high price.
Round Plate version
item.conditiontext: I have 2 versions: the plain disk, and the large "X".

item.name: Bamboleo
item.comment:
I really enjoy dexterity games, and this one is a lot of fun. Balancing the plate can be trick at first, but it gets easier with practice. Well worth the rather high price.
"X" version

item.name: Bananagrams
item.comment: A fast and addictive filler

item.name: BANG!
item.comment: Fun game and the kids like it, I found it better than i expected.

item.name: BANG! A Fistful of Cards
item.comment: I don't think I liked the "event card deck" aspect very much, but if that does not bother you, then by all means this is a worthy expansion.

item.name: BANG! Dodge City
item.comment: Nice addition. 3 player rules are good as well.

item.name: BANG! Face Off
item.comment: Surprisingly good boardgame variation.

item.name: BANG! High Noon
item.comment: Adds a few nice twists onto a game that can become repetitive.

item.name: BANG! The Dice Game
item.comment: Huge improvements over the card game

item.name: Barrel of Monkeys
item.comment: Who the hell added this to the database? It's not a game. It's a toy.

item.name: Basari
item.comment: A surprising find. I like the negotiation aspect. It has really been useful in playing with my kids, teaching them to look at others positions while playing.

item.name: Batavia
item.comment: Another theme that could use an update, but the game itself is solid, giving you a lot to think about on a turn, and a lot going on around you. Nicely done.

item.name: Battle Beyond Space
item.comment: It is what it is, a fun, fast, combat space game. For what it does, it does very well.

item.name: Battle Cry
item.comment: Very good game. I prefer to play each scenario twice at a sitting, and the winner is who did best overall, because, as in real wars, not every scenario is perfectly balanced. Lovely bits as well, and a beautiful board.

item.name: Battle Line
item.comment: I shelled out big bucks for this on eBay. I was happy to do so since this is such a great game. Plays fast, teaches easily. Love it. Love it. Love it.

item.name: Battle of the Bands
item.comment: Nicely themed and fast playing. Chaotic and light.

item.name: Battle of the Bands: Backstage Pass
item.comment: Great for making boy-bands and girl-bands and adds enough cards to play with 6. Pretty much a must have exapansion to give the core game legs.

item.name: Battle of the Bands: Encore Edition
Battle of the Sexes
item.comment: Completely unfun and unfunny.

item.name: Battleball
item.comment: Great fun, fast game. My buddy and I will often play 10-12 games in a row, staying up all night talking trash and facing off on the gridiron.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: Without a doubt, the best of the C&C Series. The Lore cards add to the strategy of the game, and help to balance the luck, and make the game feel very themetic. Fabulous!

item.name: BattleLore: Call to Arms
item.comment: An interesting idea, I am not sure if it is polished enough to do away with scenarios altogether, but it is nice to have.

item.name: BattleLore: Dwarven Battalion Specialist Pack
item.comment:
Dwarves, MMMmmmmmmMMMmm.
Great addition to the game. Now, we wants elvses and hobbitses.

item.name: BattleLore: Earth Elemental
item.comment: Fun, not game breaking.

item.name: BattleLore: Epic BattleLore
item.comment: I enjoy the larger game, and I find it helps the game as the setup time to play time can be a bad ratio otherwise.

item.name: BattleLore: For Troll and Country
item.comment: Not entirely necessary, but a nice addition

item.name: BattleLore: Goblin Marauders Specialist Pack
item.comment: I did not expect to like the Goblin packs much, but they had some surprises that I thought made them very interesting.

item.name: BattleLore: Goblin Skirmishers Specialist Pack
item.comment: I did not expect to like the Goblin packs much, but they had some surprises that I thought made them very interesting.

item.name: BattleLore: Hill Giant
item.comment: Fun, not game breaking.

item.name: BattleLore: Scottish Wars
item.comment: A very thematic a fun addition for the BL fan

item.name: BattleLore: The Hundred Years' War Crossbows & Polearms
item.comment: The expansion i was most excited about, and I was not disappointed. The new unit types add a great deal of decision making, especially when added to the Call To Arms set. Must-have.

item.name: Battleship
item.comment: Not a bad game. I like to play that each player launches X missiles at once, then finds out if they hit. X=number of their own ships remaining.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: A great load of fun, and very thematic. It is hard to win, harder even still if the cylons are good at what they do. despite the flaws, the gameplay engages and succeeds VERY well, creating an always enjoyable game.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica: Exodus Expansion
item.comment: A very good addition to the game, giving the base game legs and adding to the options and difficulty.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica: Pegasus Expansion
item.comment: A bit longer than the base game, but a good variety, and an enjoyable experience.

item.name: Bausack: Sac Noir
item.comment: I own the Bausack-Sac Noir version. I really enjoy dexterity games, and this one, despite some fiddly rules, is really one of the best. A tower building game that makes all others pale.

item.name: Bean Trader
item.comment: The game herein is longer, less fun, and more fiddly than just playing Bohnanza twice.

item.name: Beer & Pretzels
item.comment: Silly fun, but with some strategery in there.

item.name: Beer & Pretzels: Purple Coaster Expansion
item.comment: Nice to add another player

item.name: Beer Money
item.comment: As good as the original.

item.name: Beetlez
item.comment: Cute and light speed game, with huge doses of luck.

item.name: Before I Kill You, Mr. Bond
item.originalname: James Ernest's Totally Renamed Spy Game
item.comment: Plays very poorly with 2. Game has a wonderful humor value and should be played with bad accents and over-the-top drama.

item.name: Before the Wind
item.comment: I found this to be a very interesting game and i really enjoyed the give and take aspects. A fun one i look forward to playing again soon.

item.name: Bellz!
item.comment: Cute, but ultimately, rings a little flat.

item.name: Beowulf: The Legend
item.comment: Decent game, though it feels a bit too random. Theme is definitely taped on, and flaps loose in places.

item.name: Beowulf: The Movie Board Game
item.comment: A great successor to kingdoms, with some interesting layouts and events

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
item.comment: A lot of replayability. Fun, very RPG-like feel. The game really changes everytime. I have a blast playing it.

item.name: Between Two Cities
item.comment: A very nice light, quick, semi-co-op

item.name: Big City
item.comment: Terrific building game, with a bit of set collection and tile-laying thrown in. Plenty of chances for screwing your neighbor, and very enjoyable. Feels like it is over too soon, I want to keep playing!

item.name: The Big Idea
item.comment:
I like the high level of player interaction and the amusing theme. Good game for non-gamers.
I have both the standard and the "semi-deluxe" versions. The standard game rates an "7", the semi-deluxe rates a "8", thus my first non-integer rating (7.5).
I have just added the "Big Idea More Cards" expansion. This brings the whole thing up a half-point in my mind, as the only down side was insufficient cards.

item.name: Big Kini
item.comment: An interesting game, though I feel that the game itself, the graphic design, the theme, etc. detracts from the playing. i hope to see more in the future from the same designer.

item.name: Big Kini Expansion: 5-6 Players and Action Cards
item.comment: Should have been included as the base game, as it really is needed.

item.name: Big Manitou
item.comment:
Very enjoyable game. The Randolphian mechanic of each player have identical powers is mitigated by each player deciding what cards to use this round, and what to save for next round.
Beautiful production.

item.name: Big Points
item.comment: This is a terrific and fast fun little race game. The scoring and game are improved by making the first pawn to arrive worth 0, rather than the other way around.

item.name: Billabong
item.comment: Fun game. Expensive, though. The components are top notch.

item.name: Bingo
item.comment: Not a game. Not even close.

item.name: Bison: Thunder on the Prairie
item.comment: Played once, decent, but not spectacular, tile-laying area-majority hybrid.

item.name: Black Box +
item.comment: A very enjoyable logic puzzle. Only fun as the human, though.

item.name: Black Friday
item.comment: A little dry, but an excellent game with a very realistic feel to the stock market process.

item.name: Black Spy
item.comment: A classic game that makes you think and work for a win.

item.name: Black Spy
item.comment: A classic game that makes you think and work for a win.

item.name: Black Vienna
item.comment: Great deduction game, maybe the best ever. Pure logic. Does suffer from the same thing all deduction games do, namely that a careless or inattentive player can ruin the game.

item.name: Blink
item.comment: Good game for both adults and kids.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: The game is so pretty, it's nice to leave it on display. Fun to play though it suffers without exactly four.

item.name: Blokus Trigon
item.comment: Best with 3. For 2 players, play Travel Blokus, for 4 play Blokus, and for 6 play GemBlo. :)

item.name: Blue Moon City
item.comment: Fast, tense, fun. The game is a building game at heart, and does it very well, giving player tough hand management and action decisions on their turns. I great one from the master.

item.name: Blue Moon City: Zustzliche Gebude 1 & 2
item.originalname: Blue Moon City: Expansion Tile Sets 1 & 2
item.comment: A great mini-expansion. The existence of the teleport and card drawing buildings help the game without overly changing the strategies.

item.name: The BoardGameGeek Game
item.comment: Not pleasant. Sad, because it could have been better...

item.name: Boggle
item.comment: A much better game than it is generally given credit for being. No love for word games at the geek!

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Fun game for medium groups. Nice starter game for the night. Plays well with kids and adults.

item.name: Bohnrschen
item.comment: Great way to play the game, though next time, I may remove half/one-third/some of the cards at random...

item.name: Bolide
item.comment: A racing game with vector based travel. Very spatial. No Luck! Worth trying, but some may find it tedious.

item.name: Bonn Von der Roemerzeit bis heute
Bonnie and Clyde
item.comment: This is not nearly as engaging as others in the MR line. A bit of a let down after such a wait.

item.name: Bonobo Beach
item.comment: Great tile laying game with some tough decisions. Only played 4 player, and I suspect it might be better with 3.

item.name: Boomtown
item.comment: I really enjoyed this game of set collecting. The special power cards and the auction payout mechanism were both very creative and balance game very well.

item.name: Borneo
item.comment: Odd game that feels like you have little control. Things might get better with more plays or with 3/5 instead of 4.

item.name: Botts and Balls
item.comment: Handmade, limited edition copy.

item.name: Brass
item.comment: A very interesting game of economic development. It's got a lot going on, and many ways to score. How to best make that happen is a challenge...

item.name: Brawl
item.comment: Brawl is fun, fast real-time filler. best played for laughs.
item.conditiontext:
I have the following decks:
Bennett, Chris, Darwin, Hale, Morgan*, Pearl*
Alex*, Crane*, Sonia*, Nickie*, Mischo*, Tess, Rent, Tamiya, Gina*
Ting Ting (x2) (no boxes for Shadowfist sets).
Starred decks are in shrink.

item.name: Brawl
item.comment: Brawl is fun, fast real-time filler. best played for laughs.

item.name: Brawl - Cheapass Games Club Foglio Set English
item.comment: Brawl is fun, fast real-time filler. best played for laughs.

item.name: Brawl -- Cheapass Games Original 6 Decks
item.comment: Brawl is fun, fast real-time filler. best played for laughs.

item.name: Break the Safe
item.comment: A good kids game where you KNOW it won't last too long.

item.name: Brew Crafters: The Travel Card Game
Bridge
item.comment: Game requires more of a player than i am willing to give in order to master it, but still can be fun and rewarding at an elementary level.

item.name: The Bridges of Shangri-La
item.comment: Rating may go up after more playings, but so far... I just don't get it. Which is odd, because I am a big Colovini fan. I dunno, it's odd. Weak, and not very appealing

item.name: Bruges: The City on the Zwin
Buccaneer
item.comment: Decent game of set collection and pirates. Arrggghhh!

item.name: The Bucket King
item.comment: Light game, with a few strategic decisions. Enjoyable, but not compelling.

item.name: Bull in a China Shop
item.comment: A fun little filler, with some real decisions packed in.

item.name: Bumper Car Arena
item.comment: Decently fun little game whose light theme offsets the rather thinky nature of the actual gameplay.

item.name: Bunco
item.comment: I own this, not because I want to, but because my spouse plays it with some friends from work, about once a month or so.

item.name: Burg Appenzell
item.comment: A fine game for kids and adults, involves a lot of strategy, planning, and several, gotch moments.

item.name: Bus
item.comment: A tough to learn, but relatively quick-playing tactical pick-up-and-deliver game. The map is busy and the board substandard, but the gameplay is very good.

item.name: Buy Low Sell High
item.comment: Enjoyable game of stock manipulation. I have the Motley Fool Buy Low Sell High game (which I have played) and the Palmyra game (which I have not played).

item.name: BuyWord
item.comment: The variants make the game substantially different. Far more (IMO) enjoyable than Scrabble, as it involves much more decision making.

item.name: Byzantium
item.comment: Played a partial game thus far. There is a lot going on. I consider this among the games I most want to play right now...

item.name: Byzanz
item.comment: A solid little card game, though I did feel a distinct lack of control while playing, i suspect that, were it better and i played it more, that would prove untrue.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: This game is great fun, with a lot of bluffing, calculation, and carefully timed plays. A lot more going on than you first suspect. Still fun and playable as a simple party game, however.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: les Yakuzas
item.comment: C&G as teams. Not bad... I prefer the original.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Live
item.comment: An excellent group game. Right up there with Werewolf.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Silver Saw-off
item.comment: Nice addition to the game

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Uzi
item.comment: Sweet. Slightly overpowerful, but that just makes you a target, now doesn't it?
item.conditiontext: I have the version that came with the Yakuza's Preorder...

item.name: Cabale
item.comment: Good abstract game for more than 2 players. There are not enough of those.

item.name: Caf International
item.comment: Fun, but a bit formulaic, and heavily dpendant on tile-drawing luck.

item.name: Caf International: Das Kartenspiel
item.comment: Very well preserved flavor of the board game.

item.name: Cairo
item.comment: Far and away the best flicking/delivery/area majority/roll and move/game i own. loads o' fun, really. give it a try.

item.name: California
item.comment: The theme is uninspired, but the gameplay is quite good. Requires some strategic thinking, some tactical decisions, and some luck. A fine way to spend 45 minutes.

item.name: Camelot Legends
item.comment: Enjoyable game, great for the Magic-type player.

item.name: Can't Stop
item.comment: The best dice-based filler there is

item.name: Can't Stop!
item.comment: The best dice-based filler there is

item.name: Canal Grande
item.comment: The reversed thinking process required from most train games makes this one interesting.

item.name: Canal Mania
item.comment: Initial rating after one play. Plays a bit like Volldampf, and a whole lot less like Age of Steam than you might expect. Good game, and i can see playing it with groups not willing to make the time/effort expenditure of AoS.

item.name: Canaletto
item.comment: Lacking in control, and with the very acquire-ish problem of being locked out of an early set keeping you from more money, it seemed only OK.

item.name: Canasta Caliente
item.comment: We got this and taught it to some friends and our oldest son. Suprisingly good play. Cards are decent quality.

item.name: Candamir: The First Settlers
item.comment: Ugh. Not much interaction. Not much fun.

item.name: Capitol
item.comment: Excellent. One of Mr. Moon & Weissblum's finest ever.

item.name: Caprice
item.comment: Great yard sale find. OK game play. Nice if you are feeling like a quick-playing abstract.

item.name: Car Tricks
item.comment: A race game crossed with a trick taking game. It actually works though...

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Fun game, easy to learn. We always play with some, but not all of the expansions. Makes the game much better.

item.name: Carcassonne: Abbey & Mayor
item.comment: A fine addition to the line, though i felt the barns were a bit useless, everything else seemed solid and workable.

item.name: Carcassonne: Der Tunnel
item.comment: Homemade version.

item.name: Carcassonne: Die Huser
item.comment: Homemade version owned. I used wood bits (orange) for the buildings: Disks as sheds (animal pens), Houses as houses, and Cylinders as towers.

item.name: Carcassonne: Die Katharer
item.comment: I love how much these 4 tiles can change the flavor of the game...

item.name: Carcassonne: Hunters and Gatherers
item.comment: I prefer this to the original. Hunters are much easier to score than farmers.

item.name: Carcassonne: King & Scout
item.comment: Does not add much. pretty harmless though...

item.name: Carcassonne: The Castle
item.comment: Great 2-player game for me and the eldest son.

item.name: Carcassonne: The City
item.comment: This is the best of the Carcassonne thus far, I feel. I benefits from a balance among meeple options that the others lack.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Discovery
item.comment: Decent, but not as good as The City. City is the best Carc, IMO.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Expansion
item.comment: We always play with a variety of the expansions. Makes the game much better.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Mini Expansion
item.comment: A set of tiles not found elsewhere, and some that add in small way to the other expansions. Nice to have.

item.name: Carcassonne: The Phantom
item.comment: An interesting addition. I like anything that makes for tough decisions, and this does.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River
item.comment: We always play with a variety of the expansions. Makes the game much better.

item.name: Carcassonne: The River II
item.comment: Adds little, but not hard to add. The fork in the river looks nice, at least.

item.name: Carcassonne: Traders & Builders
item.comment: We always play with a variety of the expansions. Makes the game much better.

item.name: Cardcassonne
item.comment: A card game variant to the game. I would rather play the regular game.

item.name: Cargo
item.comment: Nice game, good balance. The random setup at the start can be a bit unbalancing, bu that will average out over time.

item.name: Caribbean
item.comment: Terrific game, even though I usually dislike blind-bidding. The game bits are fantastic, and the game is very quick to play (30 minutes includes the rules explanation).

item.name: Carolus Magnus
item.comment: I wanted to like this so much more, but if the dice are kind to you, there is no way to prevent you from winning, or unkind, no one to keep from scoring miserably.

item.name: Carson City
item.comment: An interesting combination of variable powers and worker placement.

item.name: Cartagena
item.comment: I like this game alot. Fun and fast. I prefer the version with draw cards shown. Very enjoyable. We play 2 player by placing 1 pawn for a neutral color on each of the board pieces, each on a different symbol. This gives more options and allows for a bit faster game. Also helps reduce the chance of the lock up occuring in 2 player.

item.name: Cartagena 2. The Pirate's Nest
item.comment: Adds in interesting twist to the original, though the gameplay is lengthened somewhat...

item.name: Casa Grande
item.comment: A very fun, though much lighter, game in the same vein as Torres, essentially.

item.name: Cash-a-Catch
item.comment:
Horrible, absolutely awful. This game seems like it is supposed to be about complex valuations and tough decisions, but comes down to just trying not to screw yourself over. No fun at all.
Economic games should not offer a way to take yourself out of the game completely on the first round.

item.name: Castellers
item.comment: An odd game that needed some development.

item.name: A Castle for All Seasons
item.comment: Somewhat unremarkable.

item.name: A Castle for All Seasons: Winter Cards
item.comment: Slightly remarkable. ;)

item.name: Castle Panic
item.comment: Pandemic re-themed

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: Feld best, an interesting game of tile-laying, worker placement, and variable powers.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 1st Expansion New Player Boards
item.comment: Adds nice variety.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 2nd Expansion New Hex Tiles
Catan Card Game
item.comment: Just what you need when you can only find 2 and you *really* want to play Settlers. Not as good as finding 2 more and getting a game of the real thing in, but still good.

item.name: Catan Card Game: Expansion Set
item.comment: The card game is a good 2-player substitute for Settlers. The expansions add a bit, but the core game is better by itself.

item.name: Catan Dice Game
item.comment: A very enjoyable variant. recommended.

item.name: Catan Histories: Settlers of America Trails to Rails
item.comment: A fun, if somewhat overlong, Settlers variant.

item.name: Catan Histories: Struggle for Rome
item.comment: An excellent variation on the Settlers base game, but with longer game play and less trading. Throughly enjoyable.

item.name: Catch Phrase!
item.comment: Better than most party games. Need to have the right crowd. Some people just don't know jack.

item.name: Cathedral
item.comment: A bit on the light side, though often very beautiful.

item.name: Caylus
item.comment:
Fantastically tight and balanced game, but it really rewards overanalysis and the player who spends all of his time reading strategy articles just a bit too much for my taste.
Ever so slightly too long.
With time, it has paled in comparison to similar games, most notably, Agricola.

item.name: Caylus Expansion: The Jeweller
item.comment: Meh. Another building. OK, take it or leave it. Not a deal breaker either way

item.name: Caylus Magna Carta
item.comment: Terrific lighter, faster version of Caylus. Lacks in depth of play, i think. Time will tell....

item.name: Celtica
item.comment: As bad as you have heard.

item.name: Chang Cheng
item.comment:
An interesting game. Reminds me of something, but I can't quite put my finger on it...
The gameplay is interesting, and the game hides its strategy well.

item.name: Chaos Tiles
item.comment: Hard to tell if a tile play is legal, or what. the tiles are nicely made, but the gameplay is not that engaging.

item.name: Cheeky Monkey
item.comment: Cute little game, a nice filler with excellent components. A fun, push-your-luck experience.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: I used to enjoy it a great deal more. Was a real life chess geek in High school. Second chair on my HS team. First chair after we moved, though the second HS was in WV, so it wasn't much of an accomplishment to become the best player there.

item.name: Chez Dork
item.comment: More of the humor-over-gameplay type of games from SJG.

item.name: Chez Geek
item.comment: Good theme makes for a really fun game, but the mechanics are wonky. Not surprising given that this is from the folks that did munchkin, but still...

item.name: Chez Geek 2: Slack Attack
item.comment: Good theme makes for a really fun game, but the mechanics are wonky. Not surprising given that this is from the folks that did munchkin, but still... The expansion fits in seamlessly.

item.name: Chez Geek 3: Block Party
item.comment: Good theme makes for a really fun game, but the mechanics are wonky. Not surprising given that this is from the folks that did munchkin, but still... The expansion fits in seamlessly.

item.name: Chez Greek
item.comment: It helps to have pledged back in the college days. I swear I knew everyone of these people.

item.name: Chez Grunt
item.comment: My ex-military friends like this more than I do. Still a decent game in the Chez Geek tradition...

item.name: Chicago Express
item.comment: This is a train game with a lot going on. It takes multiple games to even begin to wrap your head around all the interactions in the gameplay.

item.name: Chicken Cha Cha Cha
item.comment: Fun way to spend time with young kids.

item.name: Chief Herman's Holiday Fun Pack
item.comment:
I am giving this a rating of 6 as it is a collection of several different games, which i feel average out to about a 6.
Most have almost no connection between theme and mechanics, and many feel like, with different mechanics and more substance added via subsystems, they could be fleshed out from filler games into a filling meal of a game. Highly recommended for anyone who enjoys thinking about what makes up a good game. There is the skeleton of greatness in here in several different places.

item.name: Chill: Black Morn Manor
item.comment:
Nostalgia rating?
I loved playing this in college. I recently got a copy and plan to try it again this Halloween.

item.name: China
item.comment: Good, but i still prefer the original. Granted, I think Web of Power is best with 3, and I have only played China with 4 or 5, but much of the tension has gone out of this game. China has less luck, and it almost feels like your decisions are completely obvious.

item.name: China Erweiterung
item.comment: Adds some depth, but the base game is easily one of the best 3-player games available, so it is not really necessary.

item.name: Chinatown
item.comment: Feels a little like what Acquire might be if you added a trading element to it. I really enjoy the game, and find it immensely replayable. This is a great trading game and deserves a spot in almost anyone's collection.

item.name: Chip-Chip Hurra
item.comment: Silly fun game for kids, that, like so many other kids games, can be played and enjoyed by a group of fun-loving adults as well.

item.name: Chrononauts
item.comment: Not a huge fan of chaotic games like this, but still... I seem to always enjoy playing.

item.name: Chrononauts: Lost Identities
item.comment: An interesting addition

item.name: Chrononauts: The Gore Years
item.comment: A good way to give more familiar choices to the game

item.name: Cineplexity
item.comment: I liked this apples-to-apples type game, though I don't see enough movies to really be competitive.

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: This game is best when played with less than the full complement possible. 3-5 is good. I find it almost intolerable with more, especially if they are AP prone types.

item.name: Citadels: The Dark City
item.comment: Adds a little variety. I like that.

item.name: The Cities and Knights of Catan
item.comment: Not as good as the original IMO. It make the game too long.

item.name: The Cities and Knights of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: Not as good as the original IMO. It make the game too long. Especially with 6 players.

item.name: La Citt
item.comment: Very tense, lots of tough, meaningful decisions, lots of player interaction. Great game overall.

item.name: City and Guilds
item.comment: This game had a lot going on, and multiple means of scoring mean that various strategies are valid. One must not forget the guild scoring at the end, however.

item.name: Cityscape
item.comment: I do seem to enjoy abstracts, especially wooden ones. Not sure why this doesn't grab me more.

item.name: Civilization
item.comment: Only played twice, but a masterpiece.

item.name: Clans
item.comment: Excellent light strategy game. Very fun to play, and easy for others to learn.

item.name: Classic Wooden Checkers
item.comment: Not much to say here...

item.name: Cleopatra and the Society of Architects
item.comment: Played at GOF 2006. Very fun, some great game mechanisms here, and tons of eye candy. Very enjoyable. On the lighter side, Will appeal to the family gamer.

item.name: Clippers
item.comment: Beautiful game. The bits could be a little bigger, but a nice game with well-balanced and unique gameplay.

item.name: Clocktowers
item.comment: Surprising little game... light, but engaging. nice artwork, fast playing.

item.name: Cloud 9
item.comment: A push your luck game with some communal bluffing. Not bad, but not great.

item.name: Clout Fantasy
item.comment: Wow, was the world clamoring for this?
item.conditiontext: 2 Starter Sets: Centaurs & Goblins and Elves & Undead...

item.name: Clue
item.comment: One of the better clasics that actually stands up halfway decently over time.

item.name: Clue FX
item.comment: Electronic talking clue. If you don't grasp the needed info from that, i don't think i can help you.

item.name: Clue: The Card Game
item.comment: A little better than the board game, but not by much

item.name: Clue: The Great Museum Caper
item.comment: A decent improvement to Clue, and a game we can get certain relatives to play.

item.name: Cluzzle
item.comment: One of my favorite party games. Really enjoyable answering questions in an obscutory fashion. The fact that the worse you are at sculpting, the better you will do is almost a built in game balancer. ;)

item.name: Coast-to-Coast Rails
item.comment: Distills auction and share based train games down to their essence, but loses something in the process. Nice game length though.

item.name: Coda
item.comment: Fairly decent deduction game, though it lends itself to certain strategies a bit too easily.

item.name: Code 777
item.comment: Homemade version. Great deduction game, plays fast and encourages creative thinking.

item.name: Code 777
item.comment: Great deduction game, plays fast and encourages creative thinking.

item.name: Codenames
item.comment: Great party game that offers more thinkiness than the standard fare in that category. I could see playing this over and over all night long.

item.name: Collectors Dominoes Double Twelve
item.comment: Double-Twelves. We prefer to play 5's though Mexican Train sometimes gets played as well.

item.name: Coloretto
item.comment: One of the best filler games I own

item.name: Coloretto: Catalogue edition #6
item.comment: Really changes the game and makes for new tactical choices.

item.name: Coloretto: The Extra Cards
item.comment: Adds a few decisions to the coloretto mix. A good expansion.

item.name: Colossal Arena
item.comment: Very fun game of prediction and bluffing. The theme is oddly appropriate.

item.name: Colosseum
item.comment: Interesting game with a lot going on. Has a similar feel to PoF, but lighter, and more player interaction. The early game can be very luck driven.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment:
The best implementation of the series yet.
Edit: Second best, as BattleLore beats it slightly. I prefer the blocks to the minis, and it is still a great game, but the lore system is great.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients Expansion Pack #1 Greece & Eastern Kingdoms
item.comment: I prefer these battles to the originals, though more terrain tiles and options would have been nice

item.name: Comuni
item.comment: An excellent game with careful planning and play. Very enjoyable

item.name: Condottiere
item.comment: Vaguely unsatisfying, but the potential for a real game certainly feels like it is there. A shame, really.

item.name: Conquest of Pangea
item.comment: A game with beautiful components, but with very little to offer in the way of gameplay.

item.name: Control Nut!
item.comment: Very enjoyable partnership game. Trick-taking never had it so good. If you enjoy games like Tichu, Die Sieben Siegel, Victory and Honor or Dia De Los Muertos (Four Dragons), you should acquire this game.

item.name: Corruption
item.comment: Fun game, with a nice player interaction level. A great alternative to Citadels when you have seven.

item.name: Corsairs
item.comment: Similar to Loot (Pirat/Korsar), but with some extra set collecting mechanisms and the addition of a push your luck element. Nice, Light, decent fun.

item.name: Cosmic Coasters
item.comment: Not a bad little tactical abstract game. can become dreary if played too seriously.

item.name: Cosmic Cows
item.comment:
Basically, 2 player yahtzee with a tug-of-war mechanic for scoring/ending the game. Not bad for a dice game, and has cute bits.
Purchased for my wife, who is a bovine freak.

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
Wow, just didn't get it. Seemed like an awful lot of work and a huge amount of production masking the fact that the game is just not that fun.
Reminded me in many ways of Atlantic Storm...

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment:
No, no, no. Not for me.
This was an exercise in tedium and boredom with a thin veneer of deciding who everyone wanted to win if it could not be them.

item.name: Cosmic Wimpout
item.comment: Not a terrible way to pass the time while waiting for your food in a restaurant.

item.name: Coup
item.comment: A very quick game, but one with some depth. Negotiation, bluffing. This is a fun game.

item.name: Cowabunga
item.comment: Terrific, light filler. Excellent components.

item.name: CrackeD ICE
item.comment: Fun game, tight, Bamboleo in reverse.

item.name: Cranium Hoopla
item.comment: It was a gift. Quite fun to play actually.

item.name: Creationary
item.comment: Charades with Legos. Cute

item.name: Cribbage
item.comment: Still love the classics

item.name: Crocodile Pool Party
item.comment: Wow, this is awful.

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment: My board was made by Stan and Carl Hilinski and can be seen at http://www.hilinski.net/woodgames/crokinole_gallery/Mercy.jpg. I love the game, and will play anytime. I lose more than I win.

item.name: Crude: The Oil Game
item.comment: Overrated. the game has a number of complex mechanisms that interact well and seem to do a good job of simulating the target, but it is unexciting, plodding and formulaic. Lovely bits, though...

item.name: Cuba
item.comment: In a year with many games that feel derivative, none feels that way more so than Cuba does. A fine game, but nothing here feels particularly new, fresh, or, interesting.

item.name: Cube Farm
item.comment: Not bad. Light and fast.

item.name: Dancing Dice
item.comment: The only real decision here is deciding where to score your rolls, on the first dance or the second. Other than that, you have to take it for the light luckfest it is.

item.name: Darjeeling
item.comment: Felt like you had little real control, and that the game was over a bit too quickly. i certainly found the scoring interesting and innovative, but that was not enough to save an otherwise wholly unremarkable game.

item.name: Darkness Falls on Sevinpold
item.comment: A decent roll-and-move game with one player playing against the others. very thematic, which makes it accessible for young men.

item.name: David & Goliath
item.comment:
One of the best trick-taking games i have played in a long time. The dual nature of the taking of tricks, along with the convoluted nature of the scoring, makes for a very enjoyable game, with several different options in strategies.
I find myself wondering if the game would benefit from a hearts-like passing mechanic.

item.name: Dawn Under
item.comment: Please note that this rating is based on the fact of what the game is trying to be. It is a kids game, and one with a memory aspect. It is, without a doubt, the most strategic and choice-filled game of that type I have ever played. The theme is rich and enjoyable, and the components top-notch. As a kids memory game, it is almost perfect, and certainly worthy of the title "excellent".

item.name: Daytona 500
item.comment: Terrific racing game with betting, careful strategy, and healthy doses of luck.

item.name: Dead Man's Treasure
item.comment: Fun, feather-weight, fast filler for families.

item.name: Dead Money
item.comment: I really expected to love this, but it was merely decent.

item.name: Deadwood
item.comment: Good opener/closer. Very replayable.

item.name: Deadwood: On Location
item.comment: Good if like the base game. I find the expansions a requirement.

item.name: Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker
item.comment: Was written for humor rather than actual value.

item.name: Deduce or Die
item.comment: Terrific game of pure deduction. Very enjoyable for fans of the genre.

item.name: Deluxe Turntable Scrabble
item.comment: The definitive spelting game. I will only play it as a 2-player game.

item.name: Democrazy
item.comment: Played right, for fun and light-hearted laughs, this can be a hoot.

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark
item.comment: An excellent D&D-type experience compacted into a more manageable time, and overall package. My kids love it. I found it very fun and offered significant improvements over the basic DOOM system it was built on.

item.name: Descent: The Altar of Despair
item.comment: Have not played any of this game's quests, just used the cards in the base game...

item.name: Descent: The Road to Legend
item.comment: Makes Descent into a very good D&D substitute.

item.name: Descent: The Tomb of Ice
item.comment: Descent: the Spiky Monster Expansion.

item.name: Descent: The Well of Darkness
item.comment: Have not played any of this game's quests, just used the cards in the base game...

item.name: Detroit-Cleveland Grand Prix
item.comment: I think I prefer the Daytona 500 version.

item.name: Devil Bunny Hates the Earth
item.comment: Odd game -- not bad for a pickup or starter game I guess, but the theme is just out there.

item.name: Devil Bunny Needs a Ham
item.comment: Odd game -- not bad for a pickup or starter game I guess, but the theme is just out there.

item.name: Diamant
item.comment: A very solid filler. Plays quickly, teches quickly, and has many "Aaarrrggghhhh" moments.

item.name: Diamonds Club
item.comment:
a very solid set-collecting game with a rather interesting combination phase that works like worker placement and auctions combined.
There may be some balance issues amongst the strategies.

item.name: Dice City
item.comment: Runs longer than advertised, and it feels like an engine building game, but you never really get to build an engine. Still, I was intrigued and want to play again.

item.name: Dice Games Properly Explained
item.comment: Not quite as high on the "How badly would I want to replace it if I lost it" scale as Sackson's opus, it is still an invaluable gaming book that is a must have for gamers.

item.name: Die Sieben Siegel
item.comment: One of the best trick-taking games ever, in my opinion.

item.name: The Difference Between Women & Men
item.comment: Not bad for the occasional party game, but there are much better party game choices out there...

item.name: Digging
item.comment: Great partners game. We need more partners games.

item.name: Dilbert: Corporate Shuffle
item.comment: I like it. The Great Dalmuti is a terrific game, but the theme here really seems to work much better. The additional cards add something to the mix as well.

item.name: Diplomacy
item.comment: Good game. Better game if you have exactly 7 people. Even better if they are all old friends who love backstabbing one another and are mature enough to realize it is all just a game.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: Apples to Apples with bizarre, Tim Burton-esque art.

item.name: Doge
item.comment: Enjoyable game of rotating area control. Very easy to play. Enjoyed immensely playing it 4 player, not quite as good in 3 player.

item.name: Die Dolmengtter
item.comment: An abstract game of area control. I like it better with fewer players. Very good game.

item.name: Domaine
item.comment: Very engaging. Unique gameplay and well-balanced mechanisms.

item.name: Domination
item.comment: I would much rather simply play one of the many standard dominoes games.

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Full Disclosure: I am a playtester for this game.
Know this: The game takes several plays to really start to shine. I have a fear that the initial glowing reports are going to/may have already created some expectations that will not be fulfilled immediately upon playing the game.
The game, for me, takes some time to get to know. As you play and, and as you try differing strategies and get to know all the cards in the box, that is when the game truly starts to blossom and shine. the first few plays are not likely to make anyone declare it the greatest game ever, but as you play more and the subtle card interactions and tricky plays start to catch hold, well then it really starts to shine.
With experienced players, it can play very fast.

item.name: Dominion: Alchemy
item.comment: The worst Dominion expansion is still pretty good.

item.name: Dominion: Black Market Promo Card
item.comment:
Not a favorite card. It add some interesting dynamics, but it is very easy to feel blessed/screwed with this card.
My enjoyment of this card has gone way up when it is used in conjunction with this idea, from byronczimmer:
(http://www.boardgamegeek.com/article/4127551#4127551)
[q="byronczimmer"][q="Rules"] To use the Black Market Kingdom card, you must create a Black Market deck before starting the game. The Black Market deck is made up of Kingdom cards that are not in the Supply of the current game. The players should agree before the game which cards will be used to create the Black Market deck (for example, you could agree to use one of every Kingdom card you own that is not a part of the Supply). It is recommended that the Black Market deck contain at least 15 Kingdom cards, with no duplicates. All players can see which cards are placed in the Black Market deck before the game begins. [/q]
So you need at least 15, but you can have more.
I'd recommend everything from another set, or at least 15 random or hand-chosen cards.
Alternatively, have a specific 'theme' to the black market deck. For example, imagine some of the following black market decks:
Only way to get attack cards Only way to get +action (or +2 action) cards Only way to get +card cards Only way to get +buy cards Only way to get +coin cards [/q]

item.name: Dominion: Cornucopia
item.comment: A terrific set of well-integrated cards.

item.name: Dominion: Dark Ages
item.comment: Best expansion for Dominion yet.

item.name: Dominion: Envoy Promo Card
item.comment:
I have a German version that I use with my "real"dominion set, and the playtet one that goes with my playtest Dominion set.
I really like this card, it mixes things up a bit, adds some interaction without conflict, and is a good replacement for the Smithy or other "Long Draw" cards.

item.name: Dominion: Governor Promo Card
item.comment: This card makes little sense in the game, but is a fun promo.

item.name: Dominion: Hinterlands
item.comment: I was hoping for a bit more oomph here. Still, not bad overall, just in comparison to the rest of the Dominion Expansion Tree

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: I have been a playtester for this set for some time. I really enjoy the set, it offers more cards with choices and increases the number of strategies that work well. The cards work perfectly fine on their own as a standalone set, but the game really kicks it up into high gear when this is combined with the base set. So many really cool ways to play, and so many really unexpected directions.

item.name: Dominion: Prosperity
item.comment: Ramp up the spending boys, we're going over the top.

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment:
A great addition to the Dominion Family. It ups the complexity level a bit, but that is a good thing.
Disclosure: I was a playtester for this game, for Intrigue, and for the base game.

item.name: Dominion: Stash Promo Card
item.comment: Fun card.

item.name: Dominion: Walled Village Promo Card
item.comment: A nice addition. I love promos. I'm such a promo slut.

item.name: Don
item.comment: Best played with 4 or 5, the game offers many meaningful decisions and rewards a carefully executed plan. I need to play more, but I think this is worth it.

item.name: Doom: The Boardgame
item.comment: Whew. A three-hour slugfest of a game. Fun, but exhausting. Hopefully, with more play it will become faster and more tolerable. My kids both rated it a 9.5 -- the 6 is my rating.

item.name: Dork Tower
item.comment: A little too long for the weight of the game, and in all honesty, the quality of the game pieces is rather miserable. Still, if you like Munchkin, you'll like this.

item.name: Dos Rios
item.comment: Um, nothankyouverymuch, I'd rather play a game.

item.name: Double or Nothing
item.comment: A push-your-luck card flipping game. Not as good as it could be. A bit bland.

item.name: The Downfall of Pompeii
item.comment: Viciously fun. A little long if the players get overly analytical.

item.name: Die Dracheninsel
item.comment: A very fun game. Light, but not overly so. In the early part of the game, it is very cooperative, but it gets nasty as the game goes on.

item.name: Draco & Co
item.comment: Similar to Guillotine, with players making the best of the cards they have to score on their turn. Light, not too bad, but chaotic...

item.name: Dragon Delta
item.comment: Very enjoyable game of pre-programmed movement. The bits are very nice and the game play is quite speedy.

item.name: Dragon Land
item.comment: Very pretty game, and quite enjoyable. There is a fair bit of luck in here, but a superior strategy and good timing will usually win over great dice rolls.

item.name: Dragon Parade
item.comment: Ok game of trying to control group think and hoping you get lucky.

item.name: Dragonriders
item.comment: The production on this is incredible, but the game is so hard to play logistically, since you have to avoid knocking over things, and bumping things, and what not, that it really detracts

item.name: Dragons of Kir
item.comment: Terrific abstract 2-player game

item.name: Der dreizehnte Holzwurm
item.comment: Not much of a game, though i suppose it is probable that we got some rules wrong...

item.name: Drive
item.comment: This was a fun and interesting little game. Quite good, really.

item.name: DruidenWalzer
item.comment: Fun game with lovely components and unique theme.

item.name: Drunter & Drber
item.comment: A very interesting game with careful timing and planning required.

item.name: Dschunke
item.comment: Very enjoyable game of bidding and auctions. Game plays fairly quickly and has a quality that makes me want to play again after I am done.

item.name: Duel in the Dark
item.comment: Probably got some rules wrong, but this is a great game in a really, really, exciting package. More deduction than war game, very, very good.

item.name: Duell
item.comment: Fast and fun little 2-player game. The "advanced" cards add little more than randomness, but this game does well with a dose of that medicine.

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: Fine for what it does, but overly long and complicated.

item.name: Dungeon Twister
item.comment: Fun little game. Basically abstract with the theme painted on, but pretty well. I liked almost everything about it. I think that the kids in my family will *really* like it.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Den of the Wererats
item.comment: My favorite of the Dungeoneer series. I suspect that may be due to my fondness (well, I like killing them, anyway) for wererats. :)

item.name: Dungeoneer: Dragons of the Forsaken Desert
item.comment: A good addition to the series. I play frequently with my kids and we all enjoy it. this is the one they like the most, as it has DRAGONS.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Haunted Woods of Malthorin
item.comment: Pretty standard Dungeoneer fare. If you like the others, this will be good as well.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Realm of the Ice Witch
item.comment: Another winner in the series.

item.name: Dungeoneer: Vault of the Fiends
item.comment: Another good Dungeoneer expansion. Atlas has done a good job making sure that power creep has not happened in the series.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: Castle Ravenloft Board Game
item.comment: Very thematic, good fast gameplay. Not bad at all.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
item.comment: I love D&D. But not anymore, too long, too cumbersome, too involved. This lets me have 90% of the D&D experience in an afternoon. Perfect.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game Eternal Winter Expansion Pack
item.comment:
I love D&D. But not anymore, too long, too cumbersome, too involved. This lets me have 90% of the D&D experience in an afternoon. Perfect.
Of the two expansions, this one os my favorite.

item.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game Forbidden Forest Expansion Pack
item.comment:
I love D&D. But not anymore, too long, too cumbersome, too involved. This lets me have 90% of the D&D experience in an afternoon. Perfect.
This expansion is only OK. I prefer the winter one.

item.name: Dungeonville
item.comment: Cute twist on the Munchkin theme, and much faster as well. My kids enjoy it too.

item.name: Duplicate Ad-Lib Crossword Cubes
item.comment: Word games aren't my favorite, but this does give a nice respite from Scrabble.

item.name: DVONN
item.comment: Very enjoyable game where the tension builds and builds, unitl it explodes all over the board. Rare for me to like an abstract this much...

item.name: Early American Chrononauts
item.comment: Fun game, with a lot of theme. Lasts a bit too long.

item.name: Easy Come, Easy Go
item.comment: Simply a clever little dice game perfect for those 10 minute lulls

item.name: Eclipse
item.comment: A very fast playing version of the 4x genre. Enjoyable and strategic.

item.name: Eclipse: Rise of the Ancients
item.comment: In truth this is a collection of mini-expansions, making it, IMO must have, as it adds a lot and you don't have to keep anything you don't want.

item.name: Eclipse: Rise of the Ancients The Tractor Beam
item.comment: Not necessary, but hey, why not, right?

item.name: EcoFluxx
item.comment: I really like the more integrated nature of the keepers/goals.

item.name: Edel, Stein & Reich
item.comment: Fun, tense game of negotiation and predicting other players choices. Many paths to victory.

item.name: Egizia
item.comment: An enjoyable take on the worker-placement-on-a-path genre. I found it good fun, and worthy of more study/play.

item.name: Eiertanz
item.comment: Silly fun, great late night game. Meant for children, better for adults.

item.name: Eine Frage der hre
item.comment: A very good game of tile placement and area control. Surprisingly deep.

item.name: Einfach Genial
item.comment: Played at 2, 3, & 4 players. Very enjoyable and tight game. Well balanced at all levels. I like abstracts better than many designer gamers do, and this is one of the best. Plays really quickly.

item.name: Einfach Genial Knobelspass
item.comment: A series of solo puzzles that can be played speed-style competitively.

item.name: Einfach Genial: Reiseedition
item.comment: Love the components. Great game, really good production.

item.name: Elasund: The First City
item.comment: Not a bad game, definitely has a feeling of Catan while maintaining it's own identity. Nice components.

item.name: Elchfest
item.comment: Fun Flicking game for 2. Really helps to have a table well-suited to it, however. Mespi is a No-No!

item.name: Electronic Scattergories Platinum Edition
item.comment: I used to like this game back in the 80's. I guess my tastes have changed. I still play occasionally with non-gamers who are intimidated by even simple games like Transamerica.

item.name: Elfenland
item.comment: Beautiful game. Good playability and replayability.

item.name: Emerald
item.comment: Interesting tactical game with a decent amount of planning. Very enjoyable.

item.name: Employee of the Month
item.comment: Very enjoyable light game with a humorous theme.

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: A fine game with a lot going on. Despite the rather mundane setup, it is fun to see that the game plays out quite differently in each game

item.name: Entdecker: Exploring New Horizons
item.comment: Excellent exploration game. Beautifully made. Mark Johnson's ruleset appears to be interesting... Will have to try that for our next game.

item.name: Esagek
item.comment: A unique board design that excites, but ultimately the game play falls a bit.

item.name: Escalation!
item.comment: A more interesting game than i thought i would find. Another winner from the big Z.

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple Big Box
Escape: The Curse of the Temple Doomed
Escape: The Curse of the Temple Fountain
Escape: The Curse of the Temple New Characters
Escape: The Curse of the Temple Quest Chambers
Escape: The Curse of the Temple The Maya Calendar
Escape: The Curse of the Temple The Maze
Escape: The Curse of the Temple The Pit
Esels-Rennen
item.comment: Cute racing game with and odd chain reaction effect to moving.

item.name: Euphrates & Tigris: Contest of Kings
item.comment: The few areas where gameplay is slightly different from the boardgame are very jarring, but only because it is so close otherwise. The setup and play have left me a bit cold after more playings.

item.name: Evo
item.comment: Not a great game. Only played once, I should try it again just to be fair, but I doubt i will.

item.name: Expedition
item.comment: Excellent game with what are some very original mechanisms. Great and wuick to play or teach

item.name: Express 01
item.comment:
Initial rating based on 1 play.
An interesting game. The short game is VERY short, indeed the long game feels much better, but may even be a bit too short.
Can't wait to play again soon.

item.name: The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen
item.comment: One of the best storytelling games out there. Even non-gamers and non-RPG'ers find this one fun and amusing.

item.name: Exxtra
item.comment: Random dice game that is fun enough for occasional play. Has some real decisions in it, and makes for a rather interesting game for that reason alone.

item.name: Eye To Eye
item.comment: A decent party game with over-the-top bits

item.name: Fabrik der Trume
item.comment: Played many times. Another great auction game from RK. This gives a lot of control, and has the odd ability to potentially pay yourself when you win an auction.

item.name: Factory Fun
item.comment: Fabulous planning/speed game. Excellent production. The speed rules make the game fast and fun, and give it a unique niche in my collection.

item.name: Facts in Five
item.comment: Haven't played in years. A game I really enjoyed as a kid.

item.name: Fairy Tale
item.comment: Interesting set-collection game. The passing/drafting feels a lot like Anaconda Poker.

item.name: Falling
item.comment: Strange game, but fun once you get the hang of it.

item.name: Family Fluxx
item.comment: Cute.

item.name: Farfalia
item.comment: A childishly-themed trick-taking game with a surprising amount of depth.

item.name: Fast Flowing Forest Fellers
item.comment: A decent racing game with some screwage. Unfortunately outshone by other race games from the same Essen crop.

item.name: Felix: The Cat in the Sack
item.comment: Excellent light filler, with great art, nice production, and cute theme. the game decisions here are more not very difficult or deep, but the bluffing and the gotchas make it fun.

item.name: Fettnapf
item.comment: Terrific, light filler. Almost as good as Geschenkt.

item.name: Feurio!
item.comment: Fun, fast, easy to teach and learn. This is just about the ideal 20-minute game. For me, it serves a similar role to Transamerica, but without some of the downsides of that game.

item.name: Figaro
item.comment: This game had a surprising depth that totally floored me -- I was expecting a super-light filler, but this involved real thinking. May replace Poison in my regular game bag due to the better gameplay, but similar experience of the 2 games.

item.name: Fiji
item.comment: Wow, now this is cool, a blind-bidding game that isn't horribly, horribly implemented. i really like this.

item.name: Finito!
item.comment: Fun Filler, Fast & fairly friendly.

item.name: Finstere Flure
item.comment: Great race game. Oozes theme. Inspired gameplay.

item.name: Fire
item.comment: Excellent dexterity game. Also, beautiful.

item.name: Fire & Axe: A Viking Saga
item.comment: A very enjoyable game with multiple paths to victory. Theme? Yeah, not so much, but nice components and good gameplay make up for that.

item.name: Firefly: The Game Big Damn Heroes Promo Cards
Fische Fluppen Frikadellen
item.comment: This may be the ultimate expression of turn-this-into-that gaming, but I find it fun while still an intense optimization experience and the artwork really is enjoyable.

item.name: Fish Eat Fish
item.comment: Best with four. Vicious game of bluffing, looks like a kids game, but it is harsher than that, really.

item.name: Fist of Dragonstones
item.comment: Too long, and too repetitive. Oh, and blind-bidding, ugh!

item.name: FITS
item.comment: A nice game, exactly what you might expect if someone said "Tetris: The Boardgame".

item.name: Five Crowns
item.comment: An uninspired game sold as an excuse to make a five-suited deck.

item.name: Five Tribes: The Artisans of Naqala
Five Tribes: The Djinns of Naqala
Fjords
item.comment: Great little fast-playing, tile-laying, area-control game. Carcassonne meets Go, and with great results. Slightly restrictive due to tile-placement rules, but quite fun, and a little brain-burny.

item.name: Fjords
item.comment: Great little fast-playing, tile-laying, area-control game. Carcassonne meets Go, and with great results. Slightly restrictive due to tile-placement rules, but quite fun, and a little brain-burny.

item.name: Flaschenteufel
item.comment: Yowza. This game is pure gold for three players. Excellent trick taking game that requires a lot of depth and planning.

item.name: Flash Point: Fire Rescue Critically Wounded Victims
Flash Point: Fire Rescue Dangerous Waters
Flash Point: Fire Rescue Extreme Danger
Flash Point: Fire Rescue Honor & Duty
Flash Point: Fire Rescue Urban Structures
Flash Point: Fire Rescue Veteran and Rescue Dog
Der Fliegende Hollnder
item.comment: Played once. Rating may go up with subsequent plays. Fun game with delicate balancing act.

item.name: Flinke Pinke
item.comment:
Best $5.00 game you can buy. (Loco)
Update: Still haven't played Thor, but I just bought Flinke Pinke. Now, if I can just find a copy of Quandary, I'll be all set...

item.name: Flowerpower
item.comment: My favorite 2-player to play with the spouse.

item.name: Fluxx
item.comment: Fast, Chaotic, surprisingly fun.

item.name: Fluxx 10th Anniversary Party Promos
item.comment: A nice set of additions.

item.name: Fluxx Blanxx
item.comment: Must have for Fluxx fans.

item.name: Food Chain Magnate
item.comment: An interesting game. Every decision seemed so opaque, it was, without a doubt, the most fraught-filled decision making we have had in a while. A true Splotter classic already, it ranks with their hits, and far surpasses their few misses.

item.name: Foppen
item.comment: Terrific little trick-taking game. Very nice screwage aspect here...

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: A perfect game for 15 minutes. Depth and strategy are there, but the game is still fast and fun.

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 1 Sebring & Chicago
item.comment: A good track with a lot of decision points

item.name: Formula D
item.comment: Highly random, plays too long, has some goofy artifacts. I still enjoy it.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 15 & 16: Hockenheim & Zeltweg
item.comment: A good pair of tracks. Both offer high re-playability.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 21 & 22: Budapest & Nrburgring
item.comment: Decent tracks. Not in the top 5, but good.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 23 - 26: USA Track Pack #1
item.comment: Indianapolis (like Daytona) is a snoozer, but the others are quite good. A good value as well.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 27 - 30: USA Track Pack #2
item.comment: Daytona (like Indianapolis) is a snoozer, but the others are quite good. A good value as well.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 3 & 4: Zandvoort 2 & SPA-Francorchamps
item.comment: SPA-Francorchamps is one of the best tracks available, and the Zandovoort two is average, but combines with Zandovoort 1 to make what we call "the Big Board". If you only buy one track expansion for Formula De, buy this one.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 31 & 32: Zhuhai & Sepang
item.comment: Both tracks are very intense, giving many times where there is no good choice, and therefore a lot of fun.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 5 & 6: Kyalami & Ferrari Autodromo
item.comment: Nice set of tracks with many crucial decisions and a lot of opportunity for elimination.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 7 & 8: Magny-Cours & Monza
item.comment: Monza is a little below average, but Magny-Cours is one of the best tracks available.

item.name: Formula D Circuits 9 & 10: Estoril & Interlagos
item.comment: These tracks are a little disappointing.

item.name: Formula Motor Racing
item.comment: Great fun, fast playing. I like racing games, and this one does a good job of making the game very fun and fast-playing.

item.name: Fossil
item.comment: Cazptivating set collection game with several nice twists. Very nice game.

item.name: Frank's Zoo
item.comment: Good fun, fast trick-taking game. Play is easy to understand and explain.

item.name: Fresco
item.comment: A light game with an interesting theme. Everything works as expected, but the whole game never really coalesces into something compelling.

item.name: Fresco: Expansion Modules 8, 9 and 10
item.comment: Medicio did little for me, but I like the Bells and the the Wall Fresco. Both add new options when you have problems determining what to do when plans go awry.

item.name: Fresco: The Bishop's Favor
item.comment: Added little, but took little effort to add.

item.name: Fresh Fish
item.comment:
I own the Plenery Games version.
Good game of pickup and deliver. Decent gameplay.

item.name: Freya's Folly
item.comment: This is an intriguing little game with a unique theme, and mechanics that seem to work well. the limited options on a turn make the game tense. May have a runaway leader problem.

item.name: Die Fugger
item.comment: My favorite of the Adlung games. Easy to play and to learn.

item.name: Funkenschlag: EnBW
item.comment: Another excellent map. this one has few ares with real growth ability. everywhere is just so expensive to make more than about 4 connections. Allows for a very satisfying early and mid game. The rules changes on the map make it hard to manipulate the turn order as easily as you can on other maps, which offers more decisions. Very interesting.

item.name: Funkenschlag: Flux-Generator
item.comment: A nice, but not necessary, addition. I like how it lets you screw people who thought they had a market all to themselves.

item.name: Funny Friends
item.comment:
I enjoyed my one playing, but I suspect that, if I owned it, I would never really be able to play it again. I play in my home and there are kids there, I play in public, and anyone could be there, and I play at the homes of friends, and they all have kids.
You see, the game is good, and FF's got a great sense of humor, and that really comes through, but ultimately, the Green Master has made a game that is too blue for me to really enjoy.

item.name: Fury of Dracula (second edition)
item.comment: Okay, it runs a little long, and it seems like it would be more fun for the Dracula player than for the others (but I am assured this is not the case -- so far i have only been Dracula), but really, what a great game. The atmosphere is terrific and the mechanics make sense. Combat is unique. overall, just great. I loved it.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: A terrific game with speed elements, planning (well, hopeful planning as it often involves limited information) and a healthy dose of luck. Excellent marriage of theme and mechanisms.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Rough Road Ahead
item.comment: Very hard. Great, if you wanted hard.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: The Big Expansion
item.comment: Not at all an afterthought. Feels well-integrated.

item.name: The Game of Life
item.comment: Life sucks. I play games to forget about bills, jobs, speeding tickets, etc. Why would I play this again?

item.name: The Game of Y
item.comment: A very involved, and involving game that takes Hex and grows forward with it. Excellent gameplay.

item.name: A Gamut of Games
item.comment: Hard to give this a rating as it is so many different games in one package. I have therefore rated it based on the "How badly would I want to rebuy it if I lost it" factor. This one is a must have.

item.name: Gang of Four
item.comment: Good game. Easy to explain to non-gamers (well, as long as they have played poker and hearts/spades).

item.name: The Gardens of the Alhambra
item.comment:
I own the Garten der Alhambra version:
Not that great. I am a little let down that they chose to reprint this.

item.name: Garten-Zwerge e.V.
item.comment: Weird, obscure, not fun.

item.name: Gem Dealer
item.comment: Disappointing

item.name: Gemblo
item.comment: Fantastic game, great update to Blokus. 3-player works!

item.name: Genial Spezial
item.comment: An abstract connection game, and not a particularly great one at that.

item.name: Geschenkt
item.comment: Extremely good game. It's rules are understood by anyone still breathing, and it plays in about 10 minutes per hand. Absolutely wonderful game with high "push your luck" and "screw your neighbor" factors.

item.name: Gheos
item.comment: Fabulous tile-laying game of civilizations, nice amount of conflict and interaction.

item.name: Ghost Stories
item.comment: Another Coop game, this one has some nice new mechanisms, and the theme is very flavorful and not just pasted on. Artwork is incredibly good.

item.name: Ghost Stories: The Guardhouse Expansion
item.comment: It's nice to add a bit of variety to the game.

item.name: Ghost Stories: The Village People Expansion
Ghost Stories: White Moon
item.comment: A nice addition to a beautiful and re-playable game.

item.name: Ghost Stories: White Moon Green Roots
Ghost Stories: White Moon The Cursed Children
item.comment: PnP Edition

item.name: GiftTRAP
item.comment: Fun party game, but everyone MUST know each other.

item.name: Giganten
item.comment: Good game, though i feel the 4th player suffers a bit.

item.name: GIPF
item.comment: Very deep, i would likely find it a better game if i got to play it more...

item.name: GIPF Project Set 1
item.comment: Great addition to the series.

item.name: GIPF Project Set 2
item.comment: Great addition to the series.

item.name: Giro Galoppo
item.comment: A kids game, with decidedly adult strategies. Still, the single track leads to problems in large races, and makes it almost impossible for the player in the rear to catch up. Fun for 15 minutes, which is all it takes.

item.name: Give Me the Brain!
item.comment:
Fun game. Lighthearted, good natured. Easy to play and learn.
Look! A Monkey!

item.name: Glik
item.comment: Terrific little abstract racing game.

item.name: Gloria Mundi
item.comment: This game takes a lot of heat, and i expected not to like it. I ended up finding a game i thought was not all that bad, but certainly not all that good either.

item.name: Gloria Picktoria
item.comment: Another of the greatest fillers of all time.

item.name: Gloria Picktoria
item.comment: See comment in Get the Goods

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: An interesting game. Very confusing at first, but there really is a lot here. I like that someone was able to take the SanJuan/RftG idea of "Cards are Money and Buildings", and turn it around, and do something similar that managed not to be a copy. Well Done!

item.name: Gnostica
item.comment: I have an Art Nouveau Tarot deck and IceHouse pieces...

item.name: Go
item.comment: The ultimate game, abstract or not. No other game will reward multiple plays and study as much. I love to play, and have acquired a beautiful set that I am very proud of (jujube bowls, yunzi stones, and a spruce goban) and keep on display when I am not playing. I can hold my own in a 6.5 point komi match as either white or black against the computer software Aya, which is estimated to play at 10 kyu.

item.name: Goa: A New Expedition
item.comment: Rating is from multiple playings, 4 players. This is a fantastic game filled with difficult decisions and planning. Plus it has auctions.

item.name: Gobblet
item.comment: A very good 2-player abstract with kid appeal

item.name: Goblins
item.comment: A chaotic, but fun enough, mess of a game.

item.name: Goldbru
item.comment: Terrific game with mechanisms reminiscent of Domain/Lowenhertz, Acquire, and El Grande. Come off much better than that last sentance might make you think it would. Very good and enjoyable.

item.name: Goldland
item.comment: enjoyable exploration game. Like many exploration games, there is a lot of luck in what tiles/cards/etc are turned up, but at least that fits with the theme. I like this theme, and the bits are top notch.

item.name: Gone Fishing!
item.comment: The worst Kosmos 2-player game i have actually tried to play.

item.name: Gouda! Gouda!
item.comment: Surprising depth. Why do my kids keep beating me?

item.name: Gracias
item.comment: We kept thinking there must have been an error in the way we played. Unfortunatly, there was not.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: Great fun game. The interaction amongst players is very high, and the screwage is wonderfully tasty.

item.name: The El Grande Expansions
item.comment: A must have for fans of El Grande. Improves the game in many ways.

item.name: The Great Chili Cookoff
item.comment: Not bad, but there are better set-collection games and mechanism out there. i hope to try again with more players soon.

item.name: The Great Dalmuti
item.comment: Very fun party game. Sure it's just a repackaging of an old classic, but I think that makes it better, not worse.

item.name: The Great Space Race
item.comment: Way too long for what it is. Fiddly, overly produced, but still feels cheap. needs development work.
item.conditiontext: The green ship is broken, but everything else is in good order.

item.name: Great Wall of China
item.comment:
Great game of area majority and progressive spending/rebuilding
This is funny, reading through the comments so far, i see people who liken it to each of the following:
Loot Samurai King's Gate Ivanhoe Balloon Cup Battle Line Attacke Taj Mahal Lost Cities
An impressive feat, Mr. Knizia, to make a game that reminds so many people of so many other good and great games.

item.name: The Great Zimbabwe
item.comment: A remarkably approachable game from Splotter, this needs more investigation, but could become my 2nd most -played Splotter game rather easily.

item.name: Groo: The Game
