item.comment: A fairly random, and light-hearted, card game of destroying villages. Cute theme, gameplay tends to go just a bit too long.

item.name: Groo: The Game Expansion Set
item.comment: Helps the game where it needs it most

item.name: Guatemala Caf
item.comment: Did not enjoy the opening game, and the end game was disappointing, but there was 15 minutes in the middle that wasn't too bad.

item.name: Guillotine
item.comment: Fun, fast game. I love the theme, and you have to talk like a french knight from Python while playing.

item.name: Gulo Gulo
item.comment: Quite fun dex game where the kids have a significant advantage over us pudgy-fingered adults. Great production values.

item.name: Gumball Rally
item.comment: A good filler with a fun theme and while there is a healthy dose of luck in there, there is also a good deal of strategy and careful planning can pay off.

item.name: Hab & Gut
item.comment: A decent game of temporary partnerships, and stock markets

item.name: Hacienda
item.comment: Action point game with connection and set-collection scoring. Decent.

item.name: Haggis
item.comment: Tichu for 3? Not quite.

item.name: Hailstorm
item.comment: Random, hardly worth playing unless you have been/will be drinking.

item.name: Halunken und Spelunken
item.comment: I enjoyed the game, but I found the version without "Black Jack Kerouc" to be more predictable, and therefore, for me, more enjoyable.

item.name: Hamburgum
item.comment:
Yet another game about building churches!
Well, honestly, yes it is about that, but the mechanisms here are quite different than those you will find in other similarly themed games (Caylus, Pillars, etc.), and indeed they are quite different than the other rondel games in feel as well.
An Excellent game, with very good components.

item.name: Hameln
item.comment: Over-the-top bits, and a decent game.

item.name: Hamsterrolle
item.comment: Terrific and fun dexterity game. Has a lot of laugh out loud moments. High price is off putting, but the components are first-rate. If you like dexterity games, you should not balk at the cost.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: A good looking game, with a real cooperative twist. Well worth playing. Interesting and fun.

item.name: Hanabi: Avalanche de couleurs
item.comment: Included with the game version I purchased.

item.name: Die Hndler
item.comment: Great produce & sell game with many tough decisions, a tight economic system, and many chances for player screwage.

item.name: The Hanging Gardens
item.comment: Rather light, a bit random. Very nice components. A good gateway game or game for the not-too-heavy crowd. Nice puzzle-building aspect.

item.name: Hansa
item.comment: Very enjoyable and well-balanced game. I thoroughly enjoy this. Leads to difficult decisions and has a fair amount of player interaction for a game of it's type.

item.name: Hansa Extrakarte
item.comment: Adds something to the game, but unsurprisingly, it doesn't add much. I like it, and will add it to the game whenever I play if the others don't object, but I feel no need to argue for it for more than half a second.

item.name: Hansa Teutonica
item.comment: A fine, if somewhat dry and uninspiring game.

item.name: Hare & Tortoise
item.comment:
Excellent game. Very enjoyable for many age levels, accessible for non gamers.
Race games are typically given some type of luck factor to make them more tense. Hare & Tortoise has a small dose of luck (the Hare spaces), but it is much less than other race games (die-based or card-based games where every move is almost random, or your opponents options are unknown) and it offers each player precise information at all times, again very rare, especially in race games. Still comes out as a great game, and one in which every race is different.

item.name: Harry's Grand Slam Baseball Game
item.comment: I'm not a baseball fan, but this was a lot of fun. the redeal/reshuffle after 3 innings was a nice touch. Really well balanced.

item.name: Hart an der Grenze
item.comment: Not bad, but the humor the players brought to the game was better than the game itself.

item.name: Havoc: The Hundred Years War
item.comment: Mega-Poker, with a pasted on war theme. Very fun.

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: From UWE! Must see!

item.name: Le Havre Expansion: Essen Promo Cards
item.comment: I love the special buildings.

item.name: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau
item.comment: A nice set of new building to add to the replayability

item.name: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau Tablet mit App
item.originalname: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau Tablet with App

item.name: Head-to-Head Poker
item.comment: If you simply MUST play poker and there are only two of you to play, this isn't a bad choice.

item.name: Hearts
item.comment: I have a specific deck used for nothing but Hearts. It may be the best trick-taking game ever and comes close to the best standard 52-card deck card game ever.

item.name: Heave Ho!
item.comment: Great game. Plays fast, theme is amusing and not too "pasted on". Easy to teach and learn. Good opener for an early arrival on game night.

item.name: Heckmeck: Das Kultspiel
item.comment: Filler. Hangs around a few turns too long, and is repetitive with few real decisions.

item.name: Hector and Achilles
item.comment: Confusing rulebook, and uninspired gameplay. Mediocre.

item.name: Hellas
item.comment: Very fun and strategic little game.

item.name: Hera and Zeus
item.comment: Among the best of the 2-player kosmos line. My regular partner for these games (my wife) doen't like it much, so i play it less than i would like.

item.name: Hermagor
item.comment: Fun game with a unique auction mechanism, and interesting delivery system

item.name: HeroCard Galaxy
item.comment: Combat system was decent, but I felt there were too many times that a player could get behind and never have any chance at all of catching up. Not always a bad thing, but combine that with the fact that direct combat is required, and it is easy to feel picked on.

item.name: Heroes Incorporated
item.comment: Not a bad game, but it leaves you a bit cold. Everything that could be great about a game where you play superheroes seems to just get abstracted out, and there is little player interaction. It would also be nice if the crimes were described and different heroes were more or less effective against different types of crime, ditto for the SuperVillian cards, etc. I understand an expansion is coming and there may be advanced rules there that will improve on the basic game.

item.name: Heroes Wanted: Champions and Masterminds II
Heroes Wanted: The Stuff of Legend
Heroscape Expansion Set: Fortress of the Archkyrie
item.comment: Wowza, too cool.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Jandar's Oath
item.comment: My kids love the figures in this set. Well, at least until the next set comes along...

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Malliddon's Prophecy
item.comment:
Have played way too many times now. Really fun. My kids love it, and I should play it with them more than I do.
The new figures and powers make a great game even better. I think I have to buy another master set.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Orm's Return
item.comment: Love it!

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Raknar's Vision
item.comment: Nice set with some much needed boosts to smaller armies.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Thaelenk Tundra
item.comment: Way cool. Very, very cool.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Thora's Vengeance
item.comment: Decent expansion with a good set of minis and powers. Nice to have some chicks in the mix.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Utgar's Rage
item.comment: Very nice set of figs and powers

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Volcarren Wasteland
item.comment: Way too cool.

item.name: Heroscape Expansion Set: Zanafor's Discovery
item.comment: Cool Elves! Good set of powers, nice expansion.

item.name: Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
item.comment: Have played way too many times now. Really fun. My kids love it, and I should play it with them more than I do.

item.name: Hex
item.comment: Mine is homemade set - Go stones on a Chessex mat.

item.name: Hex Hex
item.comment: Chaotic but engaging game of take that.

item.name: Hey, That's My Fish!
item.comment: Fun, quick, abstract.

item.name: High Society
item.comment: I love auction games, and the several additions this has to pure auction mechanics (least money automatically loses, cards of set value, bid *not* to take bad cards, etc) make this a winner for me.

item.name: Himalaya
item.comment: Interesting mechanics, but the real game here is in managing the scoring. Players are eliminated in turn based on lowest numbers of scoring markers in three categories. thus, you can be low, just not the lowest. Memory element is important as well...

item.name: Hispaniola
item.comment: I really wanted to like this. A pirate game from Schacht. It had so much potential.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: Fun, Light Abstract. More Depth there than it appears at first.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: A great 2-player game. Tough to keep track of how pieces move, but that comes with experience.

item.name: The Hobbit Card Game
item.comment: A light trick-taking game with rules for using cards won to affect the next deal. I think it might be very hard for Good to Win.

item.name: Hoity Toity
item.comment:
Great mechanics, funny theme, well balanced, a really great game. We played with 5 players, and I can see that, as others here say, it is best with that number.
Update: I now own both the FXSchmid version and the Uberplay version (Hoity Toity).
2nd update: Because I am that big a loser, and I couldn't stand a hole in my "Wall of Alea Games" nor could I stomach filling it with the F/X Schmid version, I am now the proud idiot who owns this game in three different versions.
Somebody smack me, please?

item.name: Homeworlds
item.comment: Nice little werewolf-style game. Fun.

item.name: Honeybears
item.comment: Silly lighthearted fun. With a good dose of difficult decisions and real strategy

item.name: Hop Hop Hooray!
item.comment: Silly Fun.

item.name: Hornochsen!
item.comment: Good for fans of 6 Nimmt! -- much more strategic and deep while retaining the ease of play and the fun. I really enjoy it.

item.name: Hossa!
item.comment: I enjoyed it. Fun party game for fans of music.

item.name: Hotel Samoa
item.comment: A bit on the light side, but a pleasant enough diversion. There may be more depth here that it seems at first.

item.name: Hula Hippos
item.comment: Wheee! How fun! Bring your inner child and have fun flicking mice.

item.name: I Go!
item.comment: The tavern really makes this Mystery-rummy-esque game great. Nice tension level. Plays quick. You should invest in some card sleeves though, these things are thin as Kleenex.

item.name: I'm the Boss!
item.comment: Fun, but chaotic, and filled with Kingmaking issues.

item.name: I'm the Boss!: The Card Game
I'm the Boss!: The Card Game- Piece of the Action Expansion
Ice Cream
item.comment: Easy to understand and play game. Fast, light, but ultimately, it felt like there wasn't much going on. Still, a decent way to fill time between larger games.

item.name: Ice Flow
item.comment: I thoroughly enjoyed this game, though i do believe that each time I have played it, the other players have liked it less. It is more an abstract puzzle than a themed Euro.

item.name: Icehouse
item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.name: Icehouse
item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.name: Icehouse
item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.name: Icehouse
item.comment: Rating is for the IceHouse pieces and is an amalgam of the games I have played/do play with them. Terrific abstract gaming system.

item.name: Icehouse: The Martian Chess Set
item.comment: Hard to wrap your head around this one. Those with too much time playing real chess seem to like it less.

item.name: IceTowers
item.comment: Better than IceHouse, and one of the only turnless games i really enjoy.

item.name: Ido
item.comment: This is not one of those abstracts that even people who hate abstracts will love.

item.name: Igel rgern
item.comment: Fun, fast filler. A lot of variation and strategy. I really enjoy the game.

item.name: Iglu Iglu
item.comment: Very fun tile-revealing game with set collection and area-control scoring. Quite enjoyable.

item.name: Iliad
item.comment: A decent game, and a good update of the Condottiere system.

item.name: Illusio
item.comment: Not an inspired design. The production is good, but the lack of control was grating.

item.name: Imperial
item.comment: A really great game of conflict, diplomacy, timing, and careful planning. The rondel mechanic and battle mechanisms work better here than in antike, and the game is a tight continuous curve right until the end. Excellent game with some American-style conflict and some decidedly euro mechanisms.

item.name: In the Shadow of the Emperor
item.comment: Oy vay, long complex, not very thematic, rules that make little sense, unintuitive scoring. Avoid.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment:
The planning and tense decisions necessary in most good games are here in abundance. Each turn you have to maximize your own actions and plan for victory in a careful balancing act. I really enjoy a game with this type of planning, and both the components and gameplay here are what you would expect from an Alea game.
HOWEVER, the game totally starts to fall flat after a few plays as you realize that this game is nothing more than an exercise in avoiding pain, there is only one way to victory, and only one person can manage it each round. Very annoying game, overall.

item.name: In10sity
item.comment: Fun twist of traditional party trivia games

item.name: Indonesia
item.comment: Played once, 5 player. A physically beautiful game from Splotter, it is about economic development, mergers and acquisitions in an area of the world not often covered by games. The game is quite long, though with experience i am sure it could be shortened. I felt that an early poor choice (not understanding the entire flow yet) left me out to dry, but in truth, switching strategies brought me much of the way back. A good sign in a longer game. Game took a little over 4 hours.

item.name: Indus
item.comment: A dice game of exploration and area majority. Decent filler.

item.name: Industria
item.comment: Excellent game. Works on many levels. I especially like the keep-a-tile/lose the right to earn more money through auctions mechanic. It works very well. Every game I have played has been close.

item.name: Industrial Waste
item.comment: Great game with lots of theme and very interesting mechanics. Fun to try to work together to make a third player have a meltdown.

item.name: Inkognito
item.comment: The movement can be lopsided, but a great fun game. A must for deduction lovers.

item.name: Innovation
item.comment: Too little control, too long for a filler, too light for anything else.

item.name: Intrige
item.comment: Excellent Screw Everyone game.

item.name: Isle of Skye: From Chieftain to King
Jamaica
item.comment: Great artwork, a decent game, and a nice theme come together to make this package more than the sum of the parts.

item.name: Jamaica: Extraschtze
item.comment: Booyah. A nice little addition.

item.name: Jambo
item.comment: I really enjoy this game. The mechanics and the theme are tightly integrated, and the game plays fast with many tough decisions throughout.

item.name: Java
item.comment: Another great one from Kramer/Kiesling. I like the whole series, but this is my favorite.

item.name: Jenga
item.comment: Ok to play with my kids, but otherwise... No.

item.name: Jenseits von Theben
item.comment:
Just let me start by saying, that the luck of the game doesn't bother me.
The main reason I play games is to have fun, and part of that fun can be matching wits with other players, but a large part of it can also be matching wits with the game engine itself. This is why games like Shadows over Camelot and Lord of the Rings are fun - they setup difficult tasks that take planning, execution, timing, and luck to overcome. Jenseits is not a cooperative game, but like a cooperative game, much of the fun from the game comes from doing well in spite of the obstacles in front of you. In JvT, those obstacles most often take the form of some measure of bad luck.
I wouldn't want to play games like JvT all the time, as it can get rather frustrating fighting that uphill battle too often, but if I am in the right mood for it, a fun game like JvT is right up my alley.
item.conditiontext: Original version, not the Queen edition. Signed by author

item.name: Jochen der Rochen
item.comment: Cute kids dexterity game.

item.name: Johnny Controletti
item.comment: Not a bad game, mostly bluffing, a little luck, and does not overstay its welcome

item.name: Joust
item.comment: Quick little two-player. Decent game, allows some variation by playing from your hand, pre-stacking, playing in order, simultaneously, etc. Definitely worth the cost to download and print to try it out.

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: Quick opener. Not bad as a light filler. Plays best with at least one or 2 kids involved.

item.name: Junior Labyrinth
item.comment: The eight rating above is for this game when considered as a childrens game. It is much better than most fare in that arena.

item.name: Junk Yard
item.comment: Interesting game system, with tiles replacing cards, and some interesting interlocking ideas.

item.name: Kahuna
item.comment: Surprisingly deep game. Quite possibly the most brain-burning of the kosmos "Speil fur Zwei" line. I really want to try it out in a multiplayer version.

item.name: Kaivai
item.comment: Good game marred by a few problems. I hope the Essen '06 espansion fixes the few issues, as the game could be so much more...

item.name: Kampf der Gladiatoren
item.comment: A little long for what it is, a luck-ridden dice fest. I would imagine that it plays much better with 3-4 than with 5.

item.name: Kanaloa
item.comment: Excellent game offering tough decisions on every turn.

item.name: Karambolage
item.comment: Fun dexterity game with a twist on the flicking mechanism.

item.name: Kardinaal & Koning
item.comment:
Fast game of area control. Plays best with three. Has many interesting decisions, and the game is not overly prone to overanalization. High replayability.
Have now added the China version to my collection. Another masterpiece.

item.name: Katzenjammer Blues
item.comment: Fast playing and high player-interaction. Very decent game.

item.name: Keltis
item.comment: I prefer the ruleset from LC:TBG

item.name: Keltis: Das Orakel
item.comment: A nice addition to the system. I liked it and will play again.

item.name: Keltis: Der Weg der Steine Mitbringspiel
Keythedral
item.comment: Wow. Settlers without the Dice? No, i don't agree. there is a lot of strategy going on in here, I really enjoyed the game. The chicken race to wait on taking the last tile from a row is just great.

item.name: Keythedral Expansion
item.comment: Enjoyable expansion that brings a little variety. Much needed variety at that.

item.name: Khet: Eye of Horus Beam Splitter
item.comment: really improves the game, making pincer moves possible and adding a bit more unexpectedness to the play.

item.name: Khet: The Laser Game
item.comment: Very enjoyable chess-like game. I wonder if any variants for movement have arisen, as the game can go a little slowly...

item.name: Kill Doctor Lucky
item.comment: Good beer and pretzels game.

item.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
item.comment: Not a game, but a lottery system that takes hours to resolve.

item.name: King of the Beasts: Mythological Edition
item.comment: Not a bad game, but not that exciting either. Most decisions seem very transparent.

item.name: King of the Elves
item.comment: An excellent middleweight strategy game, it suffers a bit from confusion brought about by the lack of a board.

item.name: King of Tokyo
item.comment: Rolling good fun. Way more fun than it should be.

item.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
item.comment: More rollicking fun in destroyed tokyo.

item.name: King's Breakfast
item.comment: Fun and strategic, but light. Plays quickly and easy to explain. Good for playing with non-gamers.

item.name: King's Court
item.comment: Uno with some extra chrome.

item.name: Kingdoms
item.comment: Terrific game, plays really well with 3, less so with 2 or 4. Each turn gives quite a bit of angst, but the game never bogs down.

item.name: Kingsburg
item.comment:
A very enjoyable game of maximizing your payoff. Feels a bit reminiscent of "To Court The King", but there are more interesting decisions here than there.
Excellent components and good gameplay. they game felt a bit long for what it was, however.

item.name: Kingsburg: To Forge a Realm
item.comment: Some excellent additions to the game system.

item.name: Klunker
item.comment: Nice little set-collection game with a few twists.

item.name: Knights
item.comment: Very chaotic. Not bad, the length makes the chaos tolerable.

item.name: Knights of Charlemagne
item.comment: Very good game. Best with three, OK in partnerships.

item.name: Der Knizia Almanach
item.comment: I can't read German, sadly...

item.name: Kogge
item.comment: Wow. Easily the crappiest produced game I own. Great gameplay, however. Make sure you get the 2nd printing.

item.name: Knig Salomons Schatzkammer
item.comment: A very clever set-collecting game with simultaneous action selection, but ordered action taking. Fun, and light, but still engaging.

item.name: Kontor

item.name: Kontor: Das Exportlager

item.name: Kontor: Die Aktionstafeln
item.comment: Interesting, but not all that needed.

item.name: Kontor: Erweiterung fr 3 und 4 Einzelspieler
item.comment: Plays better as a 2-player.

item.name: Korsar
item.comment: Great little filler with a good dose of strategy and luck (from the draw of the cards). Very enjoyable.

item.name: Kreta
item.comment: Terrific game of area control and variable powers. I really think this is a sleeper hit that will only rise over time

item.name: Land unter
item.comment:
I have the newer version with sheep.
Great game of strategy and outguessing your opponents. Better with 4 or 5 than with 3.

item.name: Landlord!
item.comment: I sort of like it, but I know 2f could redo it and make it better. Not a lot of game there.

item.name: Lanterns: The Harvest Festival Promo Tiles
Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game

item.name: Last Will

item.name: Last Will: Plan Order Board
item.comment: Nice to have

item.name: LCR
item.comment: You must be kidding, right?

item.name: Leader 1
item.comment: Rating based on one play with 7 players. I *strongly* suspect that this will be *much* better with fewer player controlling multiple racers each.

item.name: League of Six
item.comment: A fun, albeit somewhat methodical and repetitive game.

item.name: Leapfrog
item.comment:
Fun, silly. Nice diviersion. Good Filler.
We played some rules wrong. Re-rated with correct rules. Much better!

item.name: LEGO Creator
item.comment: Not as bad as you think. A fairly decent game for kids and families.

item.name: LEGO Racers Super Speedway Game
item.comment: A good game for kids and families.

item.name: Leonardo da Vinci
item.comment: Fantastic game of planning, hoping, risk management, and resource management. rating may go up with more play...

item.name: Leonardo da Vinci - The Edicts
item.comment: A little variety never hurts

item.name: Level X
item.comment: A surprisingly good filler with tough decisions and compelling gameplay.

item.name: Lifeboat
item.comment: Another werewolf like game, but with more theme, and more stuff going on. Fun. I would like to play again soon.

item.name: Light Speed
item.comment: This is a terrific little game. My kids and I really enjoy it. They find that they can try for faster placement, but I concentrate on better planning and strategy, and things just about even out...

item.name: Limits
item.comment: A memory game is not what i was expecting. I got lucky it was good.

item.name: Loco!
item.comment: A terrific, fun and tense filler.

item.name: Logistico
item.comment: Another winner. A tough game of logistical pickup and delivery. Hard to make it work well the first few times you play, but after a few plays, the system starts making more sense, and you start to figure out how to get the engine going. Excellent components.

item.name: London
item.comment: Not as fun as it should be. Martin's financial games are starting to wear on me. They used to be so much better...

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment:
Rating is based on the sheer fun and sillyness factor. Unfun people need not apply.
Will play our next games with the tournament rules.

item.name: Loopin' Louie
item.comment:
Rating is based on the sheer fun and sillyness factor. Unfun people need not apply.
Will play our next games with the tournament rules.

Great little filler with a good dose of strategy and luck (from the draw of the cards). Very enjoyable.
Have both the "Korsar" version and the "Loot" version.

item.name: Lord of the Fries
item.comment: Fun quick game. Good for introducing newbies to the ideas behind some of these games of ours.

item.name: Lord of the Rings
item.comment: Shadows over Camelot was my first ever co-operative game. I think this is almost as good, but i really prefer the other.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
item.comment: Just seems to make the game longer. I don't think the game needed that.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: Sauron
item.comment: Adds a much needed aspect to the game.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.comment: One of the best lightweight tactical games for 2.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
item.originalname: Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation (Deluxe Edition)
item.comment: It's Deluxe!

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Duel
item.comment: Takes about 4 reads of the rules to understand what to do, but good gameplay after that.

item.name: Lord of the Rings: The Search
item.comment: Disappointing gameplay.

item.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Rapid Expansion Promo Card
Lords of Waterdeep: Scoundrels of Skullport
Lost Cities
item.comment: I don't know why i like it so, but i do...

item.name: Lost Cities: The Board Game
item.comment: A great game that ups the ante on the LC game and makes it a 4-player game very nicely.

item.name: Lost Valley
item.comment: I enjoy this game, and the theme is well-integrated with the rules.

item.name: Louis XIV
item.comment: Played 4 times at the GOF 2005. Game is terrific with multiple options and that lovely "just one more action needed" feeling. Each round you have to decide whether to go for the best items, where there will be much competition, or to concentrate on, and likely win, more smaller items. Your mission cards and powers help decide that. Still learning, but this is a great game.

item.name: Love Letter
item.comment: A quick and light filler, with plenty of room for tactical play, a little bluffing, and some deduction. A light-weight filler of the highest order. Likely to be played and appreciated for a long time.

item.name: Love Letter: Kanai Factory Limited Edition
Lwenherz
item.comment: I prefer Domaine, but this game is good, just a hair too long

item.name: Lucca Citt
item.comment: Fast and light, and highly reminiscent of Palazzo. This game is a lot of fun, and involves some chicken-race mechanics, and a limited number of actions that can be stress inducing, in a fun way.

item.name: Ludoviel
item.comment: Great Gift from My Secret Santa... A collection of trivia games for gamers. Fun, and geeky!

item.name: Lumberjack
item.comment: Not bad, the game offers some interesting decision points and great chance for screwage.

item.name: Lunch Money
item.comment: Great fun game. Once you get past that dark theme.

item.name: Lunch Money: Sticks and Stones
item.comment: Played twice over the past weekend. This expansion adds enough cards to allow 6 players to play Lunch Money, but that gets to be too much IMO (we played with 4 & 5). The cards upon initial play seem well-balanced with the core cards. The images are not quite as disturbing as those in the core game.

item.name: Lungarno
item.comment: Not a very inspiring game, solid but unoriginal.

item.name: Macao
item.comment: A great use of dice, the game offers many meaningful decisions and rewards long-term planning. Probably Feld's best (other than Castles of Burgandy). Is Alea returning to Gamers Games, finally, for it's big-box series? I certainly hope so...

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment: Quite simply the most involved, rewarding, and intense game ever.

item.name: Mad Monks and Relics
item.comment: Tedious wargame with random events that heavily favor certain positions. Right spot at right time = Victory. Yawn.

item.name: Magic: The Gathering 2013 Core Set
item.comment: Bought the 2013 Core Set Booster Battle Pack. I think it is 2 playable decks ready to play. Going to try it with my son.

item.name: Magnet
item.comment: A nice little abstract with good production.

item.name: MagBlast (Second Edition)
item.comment: Fun to play with th kids, must make space battle noises and Star Wars references.

item.name: Maharaja: The Game of Palace Building in India
item.comment: Played the first time with so many rules wrong that it really was a game almost, but not quite, entirely unlike Maharaja. Played again since with a much better understanding of the rules and the game is just fantastic. That'll be the last time I try to learn three games in the same day and then teach one.

item.name: Mahjong
item.comment: Basic Tile set with cheap case. Played a few times. Scoring very hard to learn, though the game is fun.

item.name: Maillot Jaune
item.comment:
John Weber brought this very interesting game. He had recently acquired it from Europe, and, truth be told, it looked much like a prototype and not so much like a published game. The rules were easily understood and, as the game progressed, I began to see something for the first time...
I was really nervous as the game was starting and he was explaining it using obscure racing terms and it all made little sense to me. By the end, I had really enjoyed the game and had a new appreciation for the game, and for cycling as a strategic sport.
I have never been a big fan of Cycling. I like race games in general, but the strategy and tactics in a bicycle race have always been like a dark cloud to me.
As the game progressed, I began to see how it was that conserving your strength on this hill could be good, how breaking away from the pelleton (or from a larger or smaller following group) could benefit your leader, in fact, much of the strategy of team bike racing started to come through. As this happened, I really started to enjoy the game.
Towards the end, I took a big chance as we entered a flat area and broke away from a lead pack with 2 riders that had tempo points left for both flats and downhills (the final segment was downhill) and I became uncatchable, and finished 1-2. Bryan Snyder got quite lucky in the sprint to catch 3rd place, even though 4 players had better starts in that sprint than he did.
All-in-all, it was a very interesting game, and one that heightened my understanding of a sport that has always been something of a mystery to me. Big Kudos to John Weber for bringing and teaching it.

item.name: Malarky
item.comment: A gift I was given. Played once. There are too many better party-format games available.

item.name: Mall of Horror
item.comment: Terrifically fun game in the same vein as Rette Sich Wer Kann. Gorgeous production values, fun and lasts less than an hour.

item.name: Mamma Mia!
item.comment: Great light filler of a game. Easy to explain and fast play.

item.name: Mammoth Hunters
item.comment: Not Moon and Weissblum's best, but a decent enough game.

item.name: Management Material: Information Technology Edition
item.comment: Fun and silly game that takes you into a dibert-esque world where getting ahead is not exactly the goal.

item.name: Mancala
item.comment: A decent 2-player abstract.

item.name: Manhattan
item.comment: Decent Building game, though a bit fiddly

item.name: Manilla
item.comment:
It was slightly repetitive, sorta boring, and not much fun. I suppose I might have just been grumpy, but the completely repetitive and random nature of the game really turned me off.
Edit: Its been better after subsequent playings.

item.name: Marbles
item.comment: A dex game from days of old...

item.name: Marco Polo Expedition
item.comment: Great game of hand management and racing. I found the theme enjoyable, and the gameplay tense throughout. Nice game for a quick 30-45 minute filler.

item.name: Margin for Error
item.comment: QUite solid partnership trick-taking game. This self-published game combines several elements from other trick-taking games, and ends up with a quite playable and enjoyable game, intead of the frakensteins monster you might expect. The collection/avoidance of points aspect will appeal to fans of Hearts, as does the passing of cards. The goal of ahand is hidden from one team, and the plays you must make to discover the goal make the game deeper than it first appears.

item.name: The Market of Alturien
item.comment: A good roll-and-move game with a buy-and-sell theme. Hm, Who'da thunk it.

item.name: MarraCash
item.comment: Not what I was hoping for...

item.name: Martian Backgammon
item.comment: Not bad, but i would just as well play backgammon.

item.name: Martian Coasters
item.comment: Fun and fast filler for four!

item.name: Martian Mud Wrestling
item.comment: Tight game, might have a first-player advantage.

item.name: Marvel Heroes
item.comment: Fiddly and complex, lasts too long, but overall, not bad.

item.name: Masons
item.comment: A good game, like others of his, a bit on the abstract side. Might be a bit fragile.

item.name: Masquerade
item.comment: Lukewarm, but I would be willing to try it again.

item.name: Mastermind
item.comment: One of the few games I liked as a kid that I will still play.

item.name: Maya
item.comment: Plays well. Action tokens hard to interpret. Game well balanced for differing numbers of players. Good, but not great, game.

item.name: Mecanisburgo
item.comment: An alternate near-future sci-fi setting is married to some interesting worker placement and conflict resolution mechanics. A little long for what it is.

item.name: Medici
item.comment: Fantastic game of pushing your luck and minimizing other's gains.

item.name: Medici vs Strozzi
item.comment: Excellent 2-player auction game and it manages to keep the flavor of the original

item.name: Medieval Merchant
item.comment: Not enjoyable. Why did all my friends suggest i play this?

item.name: Medina
item.comment: Beatifully done game, with a great deal of depth. Very enjoyable, and one of those rare games i usually want to play again immediately after having played it.

item.name: Meepile
item.comment: A fun self-referential dexterity game.

item.name: Megastar
item.comment: Interesting game of coloretto-like mechanisms and scoring. A little lacking in control.

item.name: Mgawatts
item.comment: The situations are tense, choices are important, and I keep getting totally hosed. This is a great game that plays well with almost any number of players. I love the tension in every little decision.

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: Played several times now. Very enjoyable, light, fast, fun.

item.name: Memoir '44: Eastern Front
item.comment: Excellent addition to the M44 series. I love the method of simulating the political problems of the rooskies.

item.name: Memoir '44: Pacific Theater
item.comment: Buy the Eastern Pack first, then this one.

item.name: Memoir '44: Terrain Pack
item.comment: A valuable aid. Must have for fans of the M44 game.

item.name: Memoir '44: Winter/Desert Board Map
item.comment: Another must have for M44 fans

item.name: Merchants of Amsterdam
item.comment: I'm too greedy to play this well. I always lose by overpaying.

item.name: Mermaid Rain
item.comment: An odd theme, but very good gameplay with many elements that remind one of Taj Mahal.

item.name: Mesopotamia
item.comment:
Very interseting game, with a slight flavor of Tikal in it. Plays faster, and there is more of a feeling of progression during the game. Very enjoyable.
Upon further play, it seems that the game is in control, and everyone hits the "about to win" stage at exactly the same time, no matter what.

item.name: Mesopotamia: Expansion
item.comment: Adds little, changes little

item.name: Metro
item.comment: Excellent tile-placing game. Very nice balance of screwage and playability.

item.name: Metromania
item.comment: Interesting game of tile-laying and route building, though a bit more complex in the scoring and a little too gamey in the decision process than I really wanted.

item.name: Metropolys
item.comment: Quite abstract, but a good game is in there. i rather enjoyed it, much to my surprise.

item.name: Mexica
item.comment: Good game. Weakest of the three (Java, Tikal, Mexica), but still very good.

item.name: Midgard
item.comment: A surprisingly good game. It is about time someone used the card draft/pass mechanism from MTG Booster drafts well.

item.name: Mille Bornes
item.comment: A good game. Played when I was a kid, and I still enjoy it.

item.name: MindTrap
item.comment: Ho Hum.

item.name: Ming Dynasty
item.comment: I think I liked this more than many who played it early on. There is a lot of strategy and planning, and there can be a great deal of hosage, but the fun part of the game is working around that.

item.name: Mini Inkognito
item.comment: Nowhere as good as the original.

item.name: Minoa
item.comment: An excellent light abstract, played only with 2 so far, but really enjoyed it.

item.name: Minotaur Lords
item.comment: Very good two player-CCG style battle game. Much better than Blue Moon, i feel.

item.name: Miscellaneous Game Accessory
item.comment: Wooden Dice towers from Gravediggergames, Deluxe tile bags from Gamesurplus, Spin-4-It from Boulder Games, Cards, Dice, Chessboards, random bits, Dice Boots, etc.

item.name: Mission Command Air
item.comment: Good planning easily ruined by inferior luck. Not much of a chance to recover either.

item.name: Mission Command Land
item.comment: Good planning easily ruined by inferior luck. Not much of a chance to recover either.

item.name: Mission Command Sea
item.comment: Good planning easily ruined by inferior luck. Not much of a chance to recover either.

item.name: Mission: Red Planet
item.comment: Takes the slow parts of Citadels and El Grande and mixes what is left into a great game. Loved it.

item.name: Mississippi Queen
item.comment: One of my favorite race games. Nice components, fun gameplay. I gotta get black rose soon...

item.name: Mississippi Queen: The Black Rose
item.comment: Adds a good deal to an already great game. I really enjoy managing the Black Rose, and using it to good effect (like pushing someone onto a sandbar).

item.name: Mister Bill
item.comment: A not-very-interesting Old maid Variant

item.name: Moby Pick
item.comment: Unmemorable

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: God, I love auction games. This is the master, to which all others bow before.

item.name: Modern Art
item.comment: The ultimate expression of an auction game, and it suits the theme so very well. Deep, with many meaningful decisions. An excellent game.

item.name: Monastery
item.comment: Rating after one play. the game was a bit difficult to understand, as it has a lot going on, but it was quite enjoyable and well designed overall. Rating may go up with more play.

item.name: Money!
item.comment: Terrific Set-collection game. Lots of strategy, tough choices. Quick playing filler.

item.name: Monopoly
item.comment: I hate this game. Never ask me to play it.

item.name: Monopoly Deal
item.comment: a surprisingly good game.

item.name: Monopoly: Deluxe Anniversary Edition
item.comment: I hate this game. i would rate it a zero if I could.

item.name: Montage
item.comment: Great word/crossword game, very fun to come up with clues and plays quite quickly.

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx
item.comment: The theme really makes the game...

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx: Castle Expansion
item.comment: Love the extra cards

item.name: Monty Python Fluxx: One, Two, Five! Promo Card
item.comment: I love little add-ons and promos. OOOohhh, shiny!

item.name: Morels
item.comment: An enjoyable set collection game for 2. Nice artwork and unique theme.

item.name: Mr. Jack
item.comment: Played several times now - great game, fast, thinky, a real find. I have no other 2-player games like this, and indeed don't even know of any. Abstract, deductive, great theme.

item.name: M & Lots More

item.name: M & More
item.comment: Some great 3 & 4 player card games in here.

item.name: Munchkin
item.comment: I like the theme, but the game takes FOREVER!

item.name: Munchkin 2: Unnatural Axe
item.comment: Please don't make me play more than once every 18 months. It's got a nice theme, but gameplay d-r-a-g-s.

item.name: Munchkin 3: Clerical Errors
item.comment: I enjoy the game for the first 15 minutes, after that, I feel like I need to be raised from the dead.

item.name: Mutiny!
item.comment: Good game, and the blind bidding that usually turns me off isn't too bad here.

item.name: My Dwarves Fly
item.comment: A bit too long, and it desperately needs a rules rewrite, but fun in a Munchkin or Dungeonville sort of way

item.name: My Word! Junior
item.comment: This game has surprising replayability. Very fun. Also helpful for honing your Scrabble skills.

item.name: Mykerinos
item.comment: Another Ystari winner, this falls in the meaty filler category, and makes a quite good game for four. Can be frustrating to determine strategy at first, but multiple plays are rewarded.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey
item.comment: Gameplay is a 6, but the game production is so high, I have to give it a 7. Replayability is lower than i would like, and it is fragile, so it drops to 5.

item.name: Mystery of the Abbey: The Pilgrims' Chronicles
item.comment: A very minor addition. Worth having, but not worth killing yourself to get.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Al Capone and the Chicago Underworld
item.comment: My favorite of the series. I really like the theme on this one, and thought it integrated well.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jack the Ripper
item.comment: Jack the Ripper has always held a strange fascination for me. this game was a great find early in my gaming career, and I think I like the theme as much as the mechanics.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Jekyll & Hyde
item.comment: Great game. Oozes theme.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
item.comment: I am a huge Poe fan, and this is one of my favorite tales of his. The theme is great, but not integrated as well, I think.

item.name: Mystery Rummy: Murders in the Rue Morgue
item.comment: I am a huge Poe fan, and this is one of my favorite tales of his. The theme is great, but not integrated as well, I think.

item.name: Mytteriet p Little Blue
item.comment: I really wanted to like this more. I will have to try it again and see if it was just us, or what happened. I am a sucker for pirate games, and this one has negotiations and bluffing and I really was looking forward to it. It is good, but i was hoping for a bit more...

item.name: Nacht der Magier
item.comment: Terrific dexterity game that is challenging and fun, great with adults or kids.

item.name: Nanofictionary
item.comment: Cute game, but unforgiving of those without a quick mind and penchant for fiction.

item.name: Nefertiti
item.comment: A decently thematic game with some interesting decisions and play techniques. I found it very enjoyable.

item.name: Neuland
item.comment: Superb economic development game, with a unique turn-order/action-point allowance system. A little on the unattractive side, but excellent gameplay.

item.name: New England
item.comment: I started this game as a 5, but after repeated playings, it has gone up to a 7. It has surprised me.

item.name: New Rules for Classic Games
item.comment: A must-have resource for perspective on evolution in game design, and gaming systems.

item.name: New World: A Carcassonne Game
item.comment: Not sure it is the best Carc spin-off, but not bad.

item.name: New York, New York
item.comment: Enjoyable game of city building, but there are many better options in that theme...

item.name: Nexus
item.comment: The Best game from CheapAss, IMO. Important decisions, and good gameplay with a lot of replayability.

item.name: Nexus Ops
item.comment: Terrific pairing of Euro and wargame. Fabulous bits. My kids and i quite enjoy it.

item.name: Niagara
item.comment: Set collection game with a large emphasis on the theme. Great fun, with good choices to be made, and a nice screw-your-neighbor set of mechanics.

item.name: Niagara: Diamond Joe
item.comment: 2 copies... One Zoch Spielverlag, One RGG...

item.name: Nix
item.comment: Excellent quality cards for prototypes

item.name: Noblemen
item.comment: I was hoping for a bit more from my first play, hopefully additional plays will start to reveal some depth.

item.name: Nobody but Us Chickens
item.comment: Decent filler, plays well, and seems that repeated play would be rewarded.

item.name: Notre Dame
item.comment: Terrific game of conflicting choices. the game has a bit of trouble with ability to control what cards you get, but is otherwise terrific, and well worth the time and effort to play.

item.name: Nottingham
item.comment: Decent game. Rating may go up with more plays. There may be more depth than I first thought.

item.name: Nur Peanuts!
item.comment: A fine, if a bit too long, press your luck game.

item.name: O Zoo le Mio
item.comment: A fun carcassonne variation, basically. Lovely bits.

item.name: Oasis
item.comment: Very tightly balanced game. Very fun to play, and offers many meaningful decisions. I find it has many elements reminescent of other Moon & Moon/Weissblum designs, but it feels more complete and integrated, despite the fact that the others don't feel incomplete or unintegrated. It is a remarkably good game, and had the best "grab-me" factor of any game i have played for the first time since Puerto Rico.

item.name: Objets Trouvs
item.comment: An odd collection of stuff, and rules that make you get others to guess your "sculpture". It's Cluzzle with no clay, and a bunch of weird things found in your house.

item.name: Oceania
item.comment: Terrific tile-laying exploration game. Very fun and tactical. Many moments of tension.

item.name: Octiles
item.comment: Great game. Nice abstract strategy for 4 or 2 players. Does not play well with 3.

item.name: Odin's Ravens
item.comment: To me, it seemed like this would be a better game if only there were a bit more player interaction. Still, it was fun and I plan to play again.

item.name: Odin's Ravens
item.comment: Kickstarter Backed - Aug 2013

item.name: Oh, Pharaoh!
item.comment: Cute, pretty well balnced light filler of a card game. Nice mechanics and good player interaction.

item.name: Old Town
item.comment:
I thought at first we played it wrong.
We didn't.
Then I thought it was just the group i had played it with.
It wasn't.

item.name: Oltremare: Merchants of Venice
item.comment:
Sort of what I was hoping for from Bean Trader (the boardgame version of Bohnanza), though with a different theme obviously. Still, yet another game about trading on a body of water.
I have the Mind the Move Edition.

item.name: The Omega Virus
item.comment: Rating after one play. This was from a prize table at a convention. Game play is timed and so it makes for an interesting deduction puzzle to have to beat the clock. The computer pleading and the virus taunting helps to set the mood. I enjoy playing with my kids.

item.name: On the Edge
item.comment: The first CCG I played, and for many years, the only. It was interesting, but not great.

item.name: On the Underground
item.comment: An interesting game of conflicting goals, tactics and strategy. there is some degree of luck in those infernal destination cards, but the game is quite good in that the luck can be mitigated by planning and careful decision making.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: Dark Tales
item.comment: I liked the way the game changed with the addition of these cards.

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
item.comment: This game requires the right group. The ideal players should be imaginative, competitive, fast-think and extroverted. I really enjoy the game and my family often plays in the car while I drive (I have to memorize my card keywords, but I have a very good memory, so that is OK).

item.name: One Night Ultimate Werewolf: Bonus Pack 1
Ora et Labora
item.comment: An Excellent game in the Agricola/Le Havre family. A bit long, but that should improve with further play.

item.name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan
Oregon
item.comment: A very good tile-laying game with planning and careful resource managemnt.

item.name: Oshi
item.comment: A fine 2-player abstract with exceptional bits

item.name: Die Osterinsel
item.comment: A very good game of memory, bluff, misdirection... sadly it falls apart a bit towards the end of the race, I feel.

item.name: Othello
item.comment: Used to really love this game as a kid, still a classic. Remember, kids... the spaces 2 away from the edge (the 4x4 square) are the most important to have during the early game, they allow you to force opponents into giving you access to the edge first, a definite advantage.

item.name: Outburst!
item.comment: Terrific party game. A lot of fun.

item.name: Outside the Scope of BGG
item.comment: Rating and comment are there to make this stop showing up on my "Played and Unrated" and "Played and Uncommented" lists...

item.name: P.I.
item.comment: A deduction game in the Clue vein, but much, much better. I really enjoyed it.

item.name: Pacardy
item.comment: That was... awful.

item.name: Pachisi
item.comment: Not horrible, simply not enough to interest most people for longer than, oh say about 2 minutes.

item.name: Pack & Stack
item.comment: A very nice game of planning, luck, speed, and making stuff fit. :)

item.name: Palastgeflster
item.comment: A quite interesting role-selection game. Very good.

item.name: Palatinus
item.comment: An area control game where players place markers with differing kinds of influence. Scoring is a bit odd. Expect to not enjoy, or even understand, your first game.

item.name: Palazzo
item.comment: A very good game. Fast, tense, some luck to balance things, really quite enjoyable.

item.name: Palazzo Paletti
item.comment: Great fun, blown up to great size.

item.name: Pandemic
item.comment: Extremely fun game, not overly given to dominance by one player despite the completely cooperative nature of the game.

item.name: Pandemic: On the Brink
item.comment: The expansion add some bit of life to the game, though it is not necessary. The expansion of roles is the most welcome addition.

item.name: Parade
item.comment: Sweet tactical filler that plays pretty fast and teaches quickly.

item.name: Paris Paris
item.comment: Not exactly what I was hoping for. Very random, and so close to a better game. Leaves you wanting more.

item.name: Parlay
item.comment:
Poker a word game = Meh
Actually, this is a fairly decent implementation of the idea, I just don't like the idea all that much.

item.name: Parthenon: Rise of the Aegean
item.comment: Decent, but far too long, and the randomness can be very annoying.

item.name: Le Passe-Trappe
item.comment: Great game, one of the most fun and "laugh while you play" dexterity games I have ever played. Great for setting the mood for a fun and silly game night, or for polishing off the game night with a rousing and fast game.

item.name: Password
item.comment: Terrific partnership word game.

item.name: Patrician
item.comment: The theme is similar to many other euro games, and the mechanics are as well, but it comes together fairly well. Nothing special, and for non gamers it will be better than for those of us jaded by more experience.

item.name: Pecunia non olet
item.comment: Guillotine-like in game play, the game is fun and leads to many scatalogical references. Play for laughs as an opener or closer.

item.name: Pentago
item.comment: Simple and fun abstract, plays very quickly, and the skills learned here (misdirection, pattern matching, pincher moves, etc..) help in much deeper and longer abstract games.

item.name: Pepper
item.comment: Very little game here that can't be found elsewhere done much better.

item.name: The Perfect 10
item.comment: Not bad, but way fiddly.

item.name: Perudo
item.comment: Could be the perfect closer, as players just leave when they are eliminated...

item.name: Phoenicia
item.comment:
Feels a bit procedural, and there is a definite runaway leader issue. I miss the sentinels from DZvZ.
Still, an excellent example of the Economic Engine game.

item.name: Phoenix
item.comment: A decent game. Light, but with good strategic decisions. My wife and I enjoy it right before bed.

item.name: Pi mal Pflaumen
item.comment: A counter intuitive, to me at least, game. This is an interesting little bidding/trick taking game with set collection. Great artwork. The game play may not be very deep, but it works and is a nice filler.

item.name: Pick Picknic
item.comment: Enjoyable game with kids.

item.name: Pickomino
item.comment: Filler. Hangs around a few turns too long, and is repetitive with few real decisions.

item.name: Pico 2
item.comment: Fast, tough decisions, great thinking game that can be played in under 3 minutes.

item.name: Pikemen
item.comment: Interesting variation on... something. :)

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth
item.comment: Caylus Lite? No, not really, but it is a very fun and engaging game of collecting cubes and making them into victory points, so there are a few similarities.

item.name: The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
item.comment: Really adds a lot of good stuff to the game. Takes away a lot of the randomness, adds a lot of depth. Much better game with the expansion.

item.name: Pirate's Cove
item.comment: Fun light game. Best with 4 or 5, IMO. A bit too random to be played too often, it ultimately, for me, fails to provide a really good gaming experience.

item.name: Piratenbillard
item.comment: Great dexterity game. Game plays quickly, and players get better as they go, but never so good that play against a novice is a given.

item.name: Pirates of the Spanish Main
item.comment: Very little game here. We tried a variety of tweaks, but found the whole thing lacking.

item.name: Pit
item.comment: Best turn-of-the-century game I own. Probably the only one. Great game. Needs at least 4. Best with more.

item.name: Pit
item.comment: Great production by Repos!
item.conditiontext: No box, no rules, just the cloth baggie, bell, and cards.

item.name: Pitch Six
item.comment: Odd scoring, but a surprisingly decent game.

item.name: PitchCar
item.comment: I have the PitchCar version, with the "Action Set".

item.name: PitchCar Extension
item.comment: I have the Pitchcar version. The action set is required for fans of the base game.

item.name: PitchCar Mini
item.comment: Cars are a disappointment, but otherwise, a far more portable version of agreat game.

item.name: PitchCar Mini Extension
item.comment: Had to have the ramp. Must have finger-flicking fun.

item.name: Pizarro & Co.
item.comment: Very nice auction game. Multiple paths to victory and every round offers difficult decisions. You have to push your opponents bid higher, but you go too high and you might get stuck with something that, while it would have helped your opponent, does little for you. Great decision tension.

item.name: Pizza Box Football
item.comment: A dicey game of football, some strategy, but mostly luck.

item.name: Planet Steam
item.comment: A very solid economic engine game is housed with really fantastic bits.

item.name: Playing With Pyramids
item.comment: A must own product for fans of the Icehouse system. Many good games inside.

item.name: Poison
item.comment: Great variation on the trick-taking game. The production is over-the-top, but top-notch, and the gameplay is excellent.

item.name: Poker
item.comment:
Played as a game of strategy and patience, and against players who do likewise, the game takes on a whole new dimension.
Played mindlessly, as in No-Fold-'em Hold-'em, the game sucks.

item.name: Polarity
item.comment: A game with unique mechanics. Fun, and skillful game. Those gotcha moments when the whole board goes nuts are killers.

item.name: Ponte del Diavolo
item.comment: Nice bits, good rules set, fun to play. A very good, essentially abstract game for 2 players.

item.name: Pony Express
item.comment: This is how not to design a dice-based filler. Too long, too dull, too few decisions.

item.name: Portobello Market
item.comment: A very good, if somewhat abstract game.

item.name: Pow Wow
item.comment: Silly fun. Light, fast and cute.

item.name: Pow Wow
item.comment: Great fun, improves on Coyote by making it for 8 people.

item.name: Power $truggle
item.comment: a terrific game with a lot of options and available paths to victory. Very enjoyable.

item.name: Power Grid
item.comment: The situations are tense, choices are important, and I keep getting totally hosed. This is a great game that plays well with almost any number of players. I love the tension in every little decision.

item.name: Power Grid Korea Prototype
item.comment:
I have the handmade prototype, signed by the Man with Green Hair hisself.
I'll still buy a copy, as this version is a prototype of the Korea map only.
I have played both maps, and the Korea map is excellent in it's decision tree complexity, while the China map if amazingly tight and stressful and so very difficult. Two of FF's best ever.

item.name: Power Grid: Benelux/Central Europe
item.comment: Played Central Europe map at Origins '06 and loved it. great tension and the rules changes were very interesting. I especially love the changes on the Benelux map, and the speed that the game happens at there.

item.name: Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set
Power Grid: China/Korea
item.comment: A pair of maps near the top of the list for replayability and difference from the normal game. Excellent fun.

item.name: Power Grid: Factory Manager
item.comment: A good game, but not compelling. Fiddly; Mathy; Likely not a 10-year-still-playing type of game.

item.name: Power Grid: France/Italy
item.comment:
Played three times on each map. Maps are different, obviously, but so are the rules. there is slightly different resource starting for each of the maps, and in France, a different deck setup.
Gives a great game legs.

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
item.comment: I love the new deck, the strategies change and the flavor of the game changes just a bit, and it gives PG legs. Excellent idea.

item.name: Power Lunch
item.comment: Not even fun for those of us who live in DC and work for beltway bandits.

item.name: Powerboats
item.comment: A very solid and fun racing game.

item.name: Primordial Soup
item.comment:
Played several times with 3 & 4 players. Great game, humorous, fun, deep, thoughtful. Almost everything you could want in a game. I love it.
I own the Zman games version (Primordial Soup).

item.name: Primordial Soup: Freshly Spiced
item.comment:
New gene cards: Good 6 Players: Bad
Game play slows too much with 6, but the new gene cards are a welcome addition.

item.name: The Princes of Florence
item.comment: Great game. I love auctions, and this does it very well.

item.name: The Princes of Machu Picchu
item.comment: This game works and was interesting and engaging throughout, but the end game scoring system basically ruined an otherwise fine game.

item.name: Princes of the Renaissance
item.comment: Classic Wallace, but i prefer his money games, to his conflict games.

item.name: The Princess Bride: Storming the Castle
item.comment: Gooofy, take-that game; still fun.

item.name: Project Kells: Sacred Hill, High Kings of Tara & Poisoned Chalice
item.comment: More beautiful than fun.

item.name: Pueblo
item.comment: Terrific game of spatial visualization, planning, and screwage.

item.name: Puerto Rico
item.comment: What more can be said?

item.name: Puerto Rico Expansion
item.originalname: Puerto Rico: Expansion I New Buildings
item.comment: The buildings are not as solid as the core game buildings (though i feel the University and Factory should be switched), but it does breathe a little new life into a game that can grow stale and formulaic.

item.name: PNCT
item.comment: Very good connection game with movable pieces. An excellent addition to an excellent series.

item.name: Qin: Toad and Dragon Turtle Game Boards
Quandary
item.comment: Looking for the Quandary version

item.name: Quarto!
item.comment: Very pretty abstract with a nice twist of choosing what your opponent plays, but not where.

item.name: Queen's Necklace
item.comment: Kinda long, kinda fiddly, kinda fun. Best with 3, and don't bother with that necklace trinket.

item.name: Quelf
item.comment: A silly party game, with a lot of fluff.

item.name: Quicksand
item.comment: My kids liked it, but i thought it was tedious.

item.name: Quinto
item.comment: Not a bad party game for teams of 4/6/8. Plays fast, is easy to teach and learn, and has a good scoring system.

item.name: Quizzard
item.comment: Must-have Buzzer! Rating is for the value of the buzzer, not the game!

item.name: Quo Vadis?
item.comment: Very good game. Intense, filled with tough decisions and negotiations. I really enjoy it.

item.name: Qwirkle
item.comment: Decent light filler of an abstract. Reminds one of Einfach Genial, but I think i may like it more...

item.name: Qwirkle Cubes
item.comment: I was surprised that the game actually became MORE strategically challenging. That was not what my gut told me would happen.

item.name: Qwirkle Travel
item.comment: Decent light filler of an abstract. Reminds one of Einfach Genial, but I think i may like it more...

item.name: Qwitch
item.comment: A lot of fun for kids and adults. Very fast. Loud.

item.name: R-Eco
item.comment: Decent set collection game with some interesting decisions. Nice artwork

item.name: Ra
item.comment: An amazingly fun game fraught with decision tension and a wonderful combination of multiple paths to victory and unequal values.

item.name: Ra: The Dice Game
item.comment: An excellent modification of the original.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
Played prototypes over the last few years many times (8?, 10?).
Best card game ever? Well, #2 (after Tichu) at least.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
Played prototypes over the last few years many times (8?, 10?).
Best card game ever? Well, #2 (after Tichu) at least.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts
Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment: Great Game, Great System,

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
item.comment: An excellent addition to an awesome game.

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment:
An excellent addition to the game. A must-buy. Adds more to the game rather than just a big pile of cards. More to do, more to think about, more ways to score. Fabulous.
I can say no more until it is released.

item.name: Racko
item.comment: Yawn.

item.name: Rage
item.comment: Great trick-taking game. Interesting play-down scheme.

item.name: Railroad Dice
item.comment: Played several times now. It was intense and fun, but seemed to be over too soon.

item.name: Railroad Dice: Crossing
item.comment: Adds little, but costs little and easy enough to do...

item.name: Railroad Tycoon: The Boardgame
item.comment: A great game, a lot of eye candy, and a lot going on. Multiple strategies to achieve victory, solid design. Very good game, highly recommended. Solves the debt spiral/precipice issues of AoS very well.

item.name: Rails of Europe
item.comment: An excellent update to the game with some very interesting mechanical changes and a much improved map. Still a few slight printing issues, but an excellent game nonetheless.

item.name: Railways of the World: Event Deck
Railways of the World: Switch Tracks
Railways of the World: The Card Game
Railways of the World: The Card Game Expansion
Raj
item.comment:
Raj is the game that lies at the core of so many other games. each player has a set of that is the same as all other players, and you have to use them more efficiently, outguessing your opponents on every turn.
Raj can be seen in games like Niagara, For Sale, Caribbean, etc., but here it is boiled down to its most pure, fast-playing, essence.
Great fun, and the lack of extraneous accoutrements keeps it fast, replayable, and throughly enjoyable.

item.name: RAMbots
item.comment: It's a faster, more abstract version of RoboRally. Fun, though difficult to explain.

item.name: Rampage: The Space Cowboys
item.originalname: Terror in Meeple City: The Space Cowboys

item.name: Ramparts
item.comment: Not my cup of tea. Perfect information, basically abstract game of hoping your opponent doesn't see the good moves.

item.name: Rat Hot
item.comment: A better game as Rat Hot than as Dschunke: Das Legespiel. Scoring system is much improved, and the 3-rat-showing rule makes for a nice back-burner type way to keep pressure on your opponent (much like a connection win in Attika).

item.name: RattleSnake
item.comment: Fun light little dex game with magnets. Magnets? Magnets! Cool!

item.name: Razzia!
item.comment: Great game, feels like Ra!, plays a bit faster. Still a lot of fun, though a bit less tense.

item.name: The Really Nasty Horse Racing Game
item.comment: This is a jewel. I love games that involve screwage as a forced part of the mechanics (since no reasonable person can take offence at them) and this plays well to that guilty pleasure. The screwage is not optional, and that makes it much easier to take.

item.name: Recess!
item.comment: Fun theme, but plays very abstractly. Good humor value.

item.name: The Reef
item.comment: Engaging 2-player game. Really enjoyed. Highly luck-dependant, but that is mitigated a bit over the length of the game.

item.name: Reef Encounter
item.comment: Deep, intense, fun. Many tough choices, lots going on. A real burner.

item.name: Reef Encounter of the Second Kind
item.comment: Adds several new options and changes. nice.

item.name: The Resistance: Hidden Agenda & Hostile Intent
Rette Sich Wer Kann
item.comment: Great game. Intensely high screwage factor. Best played late at night and with people who can handle the screwage.

item.name: Return of the Heroes
item.comment: One of the better RPG-in-a-boardgame games available.

item.name: Rheinlnder
item.comment: Terrific game of area control and hand management. It reminded me a lot of Web of Power and that is never a bad thing. Very enjoyable.

item.name: Ricochet Robot
item.comment: A bit dry, and more of a puzzle than a game, but fun with the right crowd. USE A TIMER!!!

item.name: Risk
item.comment: When i think of how many hours wasted playing this... Still, we enjoy it once or twice a year or so.

item.name: Risk Express
item.comment: A decently light and fast Yahtzee-ish game.

item.name: Risk: Godstorm
item.comment: Improves on Risk in so many ways, and yet, is still tedious and, ultimately, kind of boring.

item.name: Roads & Boats
item.comment:
Played several times solo, and in both 2- and 4-player games.
A masterfully designed procedural game that is extremely engaging and a great deal of fun. Lengthy without being long, it is not just an expensive grail, it is a game that deserves play, and a lot of it.

item.name: RoboRally
item.comment: Prone to a bit of downtime, but great for those with decent spacial relationship skills.

item.name: RoboRally: Armed and Dangerous
item.comment: I have played on all of the expansions at some point, and I feel that the base game is best left alone, though each of them are fun in their own way.

item.name: RoboRally: Crash and Burn
item.comment: I have played on all of the expansions at some point, and I feel that the base game is best left alone, though each of them are fun in their own way.

item.name: RoboRally: Grand Prix
item.comment: I have played on all of the expansions at some point, and I feel that the base game is best left alone, though each of them are fun in their own way.

item.name: RoboRally: Radioactive
item.comment: I have played on all of the expansions at some point, and I feel that the base game is best left alone, though each of them are fun in their own way.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
item.comment:
An intriguing game. Fun, light, plenty of decisions and a real feel of accomplishing something as the game progresses.
I was involved in playtesting the game.

item.name: Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age with Mediterranean Expansion
Roll Through the Ages: The Iron Age The Mediterranean Expansion
Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
item.comment: A nice alternative to the original rules, very well thought-out.

item.name: Roller Coaster Tycoon
item.comment: Not a great game. Very luck driven. Very Monopoly-esque.

item.name: Rook
item.comment: Decent Trick-Taking game.

item.name: Rosenknig
item.comment: Very enjoyable area-control game. Every game is different, and this one offers some tension in choices, but not so much as to paralyze the game or make it slow.

item.name: Rowboat
item.comment: An excellent trick-taking game with roots in both Spades and Euchre, a lot of fun for fans of either

item.name: Royal Palace
item.comment: I a long line of castle-building games, this one has a hard time feeling distinct, but it succeeds as a tactical game with multiple paths to victory

item.name: Royal Turf
item.comment: Excellent game. Good bluffing ability, excellent play, nice bits. Another Knizia winner.

item.name: Ruhrschifffahrt 1769-1890
item.comment: Rating after one play. I really wanted to like this more, but i felt that the random weather pattern each turn could severely hamper some players while really assisting others. I await some good house rules to make this more of a heavy gamers game.

item.name: Ruhrschifffahrt: Merchant and Coal Shop Expansion
Rum & Pirates
item.comment: Lighter game than Alea is known for. Good game, nice bits, fun to play. Family game, not a deep thinker.

item.name: Rumis
item.comment: Very enjoyable game with tight gameplay. Spatial visualization is a key skill.

item.name: Rummikub
item.comment: Rummy with tiles. A good enough game. My kids seem to like it and it is accessable to non-gamers.

item.name: Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: Played once, good game, though a little fiddly and a little long. Good for an RPG experience in a board game.

item.name: Runebound: Shadows of Margath (Second Edition)
item.comment: Decent little expansion. Was hoping for more, but what was there was good.

item.name: Saboteur
item.comment:
Played once, had fun but I am not ready to rate it yet...
Update: played twice more now, with fewer players, and i found the game to be quite good. Getting better with every play in fact.

item.name: Saint Petersburg
item.comment: A little dry, and given to a runaway leader problem or three, but very fun. I enjoy it greatly.

item.name: Saint Petersburg: New Society & Banquet Expansion
Saint Petersburg: The Banquet
item.comment: Adds some oomph without overly changing the basic game. Well done.

item.name: Salamanca
item.comment: Confusing, though i think the game will improve with multiple plays, I am not sure it will ever rise to "good".

item.name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches
item.comment: Dry. Saharan, almost. Go has more theme. What theme there is, is demeaning.

item.name: Samurai
item.comment: Very tense area control/tile-laying game hybrid. Pretty components, wonderfully tense gameplay.

item.name: San Francisco
item.comment: A fun game of area control and multiple bidding types, using two differing currencies. I dn't like blind bidding, but that aspect is minimal, really, and so the game is quite good. the tied-always-loses rule oelps to make some strategic choices.

item.name: San Juan
item.comment: Does an excellent job of balancing the needs of the card game and the flavor of Puerto Rico. Many tough decisions during play. Excellent game.

item.name: San Marco
item.comment: Terrific area control game combined expertly with a 'You Split I Choose" mechanic. Delightful game.

item.name: San Ta Si
item.comment: An Abstract game with fabulous bits. the game play is good and gives a lot of tough choices.

item.name: Santiago
item.comment: Very intriguing gameplay. I very much enjoy this one, and see it getting to the table a lot in '04

item.name: Santy Anno
item.comment: A terrific game for 6-8 and a lot of room. Those Repos guys are something else...

item.name: Santy Anno: Blackbeard at the Pub
item.comment:
Whoa! Brain overboard...
I can't think this fast!

item.name: Die Sulen von Venedig
item.comment: A rather interesting game of tile placing and shared scoring that leads to interesting decisions. The theme is not as dried out as expected.

item.name: Savannah Caf
item.comment: Not bad, but better race games exist. I think the theme is nice and the components very good.

item.name: Say Anything
item.comment: An excellent party game for friends.

item.name: Say What!?!
item.comment: A meta-game to be played during a night of games, as all the others are played.

item.name: Scattergories
item.comment: Not terrible, but unappealing.

item.name: The Scepter of Zavandor
item.comment: the game was a bit long for my tastes, and i didn't enjoy the experience much, but i blame that more on one particular other player rather than the game itself. I am eager to try it again, and I have tried to rate it fairly even though I was so tired of the player who would not shut up that i was ready to scream.

item.name: Schnppchen Jagd
item.comment:
YATTGWAT (Yet Another Trick-Taking Game With A Twist), I mean how many slight variations on trick taking games can one man play? i own 14 games that i could describe with that little acronym...
Turns out, however, that this is one of the best. Very worth finding, and playing until the deck wears out.

item.name: Schotten-Totten
item.comment: Excellent game. One of the best 2-player choices available.

item.name: Schrille Stille
item.comment: Enjoyable game with a terrific device and odd theme. Very fun.

item.name: Scotland Yard
item.comment: Good game when one player is more experienced or older/wiser than the others. One day, my kids will catch their elusive father, and then the torch will have been passed to a new generation...

item.name: Scream Machine
item.comment: Great fun in a light little card game. Very nice.

item.name: The Seafarers of Catan
item.comment: Seefarers adds a lot to the basic game. Sheep are suddenly more than just something to trade at a port. Still, the basic game is, IMO, superior.

item.name: The Seafarers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: I think the game plays best with 4.

item.name: Secrets of the Tombs
item.comment: Not really much here to entice the gamer. Non-gamers may find it fun.

item.name: Seismic
item.comment:
Reading through the comments I keep seeing references to Carcassonne, but frankly, there is little similarity to Carc in this game. Your workers are placed on tiles, but that is about it. Managing risk, stealing roads from other players when you can, and maximizing your own potential on any turn are the keys here. A key difference is the non-static nature of the placed tiles.
the game is very nicely produced, though the cubes for workers are a bit... lackluster. I would have loved to see the game come with 4 sets of colored construction cones, much more thematic.
The strategies come out really only after a few plays, and I feel the game work extremely well with 3 players, and a bit less so with 2 or 4. One of my favorites of 2006. The included variants are quite good, and recommended for most players after the first game.

item.name: Senator
item.comment: The game was fun, overall, though I disliked the Event Cards, feeling that they added little to the game. We all felt the game was fun, and the auctions were tense and filled with tough decisions. I liked the game best with 4 players. With five, there were too many Assassins, and with three, it was often easy for one player to let two others fight in the early auctions until he could win the final ones relatively cheaply. The game box says it plays in 40-60 minutes, and all but our first game came in at under 45 minutes. Overall, it is a decent, though not great, filler game, and well worth the prices you can find it for online.

item.name: Sequence
item.comment: Not bad. The game feels very random. Accessable to non-gamers, however.

item.name: SET
item.comment: Easy to explain game of perception. We like to play at a restaurant while waiting for our food. Rules can be explained in 2 minutes.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan
item.comment: Still a personal favorite

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: 5-6 Player Extension
item.comment: 4 players is still best, and I feel that 6 makes it run a little too long, but still one of my favorites.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
item.comment: Basically, a variant to make building on sea hexes without ports more worthwhile. Not bad. i would like to try it with some Seafarers scenarios.

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: The Great River
item.comment: An interesting change, but nothing too exciting. Still Settlers in all it's glory...

item.name: The Settlers of Catan: Travel Edition
item.comment: Only suffers slightly from the original. The desert always in the middle is the only flaw.

item.name: The Settlers of the Stone Age
item.comment: Played once so far. Would get a higher rating if it were not quite so long. Still a good game, however.

item.name: Shadow Hunters
