item.comment: Werewolf-esque card game with decent mechanics and nice production. Perfect for when you have too few players for werewolf.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot
item.comment: Really engaging, tense throughout. I suspect that some repetitiveness will seep in.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot: Merlin's Company
item.comment: Very good addition to the game, the additional knights add interest, the new travel rules improve things greatly, and the Merlin Figure helps thematically. Good all around.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot: The Card Game
item.comment: Ever so slightly disappointing in gameplay, nonetheless, a worthy, and faster playing sequel.

item.name: Shadows over Camelot: The Card Game Merlin & Morgan Promo cards
item.comment: Adds a little more variety to the game. This is good.

item.name: Shanghaien
item.comment: An excellent dice game for two with some real strategy and planning. Well done!

item.name: Shear Panic
item.comment:
Cutest sheeples evar.
Gameplay is fun, thematic, and light. Play could bog down, but blame the players for that, and not the game. Keep it light and fast and you will throughly enjoy it.

item.name: Shipwrecked
item.comment: Good game with 3 or 4, interesting variation on the standard auction mechanic.

item.name: Shipyard
item.comment: An excellent game with a lot of moving parts. I thoroughly enjoy it.

item.name: Shocking Roulette
item.comment: We occasionally use it to pick a first player, or pick who gets to decide what to play next. You have to really want to play a game, to play this first just to get yours on the table. :)

item.name: Shogun
item.comment: An excellent update to the Wallenstein system. Has an improved turn order system, and feels very thematic.

item.name: ShowBiz Shuffle
item.comment: Fairly good light fare. Traumfabrik without the auctions or nice board/bits. Replayability may cause it to suffer (just a sneaking suspicion...).

item.name: Showmanager
item.comment: Likely my favorite game for 6. The game play is usually quite quick for a game with this elevated number of players, and while it is possible to be completely out of it quite early, it is highly unlikely. One of Mr. Henn's finest.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Die Sieben Weisen
item.comment: Played once, 4 player. Interesting. I need another play for my opinions to fully form.

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Das Buch zum Spielen
item.comment: This makes Catan a game system rather than a single game. I like that. YMMV.

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Die groe Karawane
item.comment: Not a bad expansion, but I was hoping for something with a little more oomph to change the game and spark it back up a little...

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Historische Szenarien
item.comment: I love settlers, and both Historical Scenarios are great. Better with 4.

item.name: Die Siedler von Catan: Historische Szenarien II
item.comment: Not as good as the first Historical Scenarios, IMO, but still great and gives Settlers even more "legs".

item.name: Siena
item.comment: Almost like playing three games in succession. A little long, but very involving with little downtime.

item.name: Silberzwerg
item.comment: Good game of planning, adjusting, and outguessing.

item.name: Silk Road
item.comment:
A lightweight and nicely quick-playing trading/economic game. The players travel together on the road, each taking turns taking actions in the various trading centers. The turn passing mechanism leads to interesting decisions, and the auction system for right of determining the next destination is nicely done, and the turn work together well to make that part of the game quite good.
In each city, there are a number of actions that can be performed, either buying, selling, trading, or exchanging goods, basically, or some special abilities as well. All told, there is alot of tension when trying to select an action most of the time, as you try to balance selecting a role that helps you versus taking a role that your opponent really wants.
A fun game, and beautifully produced.

item.name: Simply Catan
item.comment: A prettier, simpler, version of Catan. Great for the intended audience.

item.name: Six
item.comment: Love this

item.name: Six
item.comment: Very fun little dice game with lots of quick action and anxious shouting.

item.name: Sketchword
item.comment: Bad. Not Fun.

item.name: Skip-Bo
item.comment: This actually isn't too bad with 4 players. It's just that there is so much that is better.

item.name: Sky Runner
item.comment: Good game, very thematic and a lot of fun. Great with more tension.

item.name: Skyline of the World
item.comment: An interesting, but ultimately flawed, building game. The brinkmanship here is just too much for the gameplay to overcome.

item.name: Sleuth
item.comment: Excellent deduction game, but like all, can fall victim to an inattentive or lax player.

item.name: Slow Freight
item.comment: Not a bad game, but there are much better choices for a light fast train game.

item.name: Small World
item.comment: Excellent production, and a fine game make a winning combo for DOW. Nice to see a good game without ticket in the title from them

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Smarty Party!
item.comment: Fun party/trivia hybrid.

item.name: Smarty Party! Expansion Set
item.comment: A must-get for fans of the base game

item.name: Smarty Party! Gamers' Expansion
item.comment: Nice cards! Tough questions, even for very knowledgeable gamers.
item.conditiontext: Homemade version, with a decent box...

item.name: Snow Tails
item.comment: One of my favorite race games, not only from the current essen crop, but perhaps of all time. Great marriage of mechanics and theme, and the bits and variable setup make it great.

item.name: Snow Tails: The Leap of Death
Sole Mio!
item.comment: Only played with the original, but I thought it made a good game just as good. Didn't hurt it at all, but didn't add much either. I have thus rated it the same as i rated the original.

item.name: SongBurst 50's & 60's Edition
item.comment: Fun for those who enjoy the music of the era, and for whom party games are not verboten.

item.name: Songburst: 70's & 80's Edition
item.comment: Fun for those who enjoy the music of the era, and for whom party games are not verboten.

item.name: Sorry!
item.comment: No control.

item.name: Sorry! Sliders
item.comment: Crokinole Lite.

item.name: Space Dealer
item.comment: Fabulous game, very tense, fun and highly tactical.

item.name: Speculation Queenie 1: New Action and Movement Tiles
Speculation Queenie 3: Action and Movement Dice
Spinball
item.comment: Great game. tough to explain, plays well. Players quickly learn just the right level of control. Very satisfying when you score. First few games take forever as your skills develop.

item.name: Spree! Hong Kong Edition
item.comment: Odd mechanics but a fun, light game.

item.name: Spyfall: Ice Hockey Stadium promo cards
Squint
item.comment: Better party game than some I have played. Needs a 2-minute timer rather than the 1 minute that it comes with.

item.name: Stack Market
item.comment: Not bad. A bit of an odd mix of elements, but a fun filler.

item.name: Star Wars: Epic Duels
item.comment: Fun game. only played it with my kids thus far, but very fast and fun and enjoyable. Good lightame.

item.name: Star Wars: Episode 1 Clash of the Lightsabers
Starfarers of Catan
item.comment: Catan in Space. Plays too slowly in my opinion, but this game will satisfy your need for a game with nice bits.

item.name: Starfarers of Catan: 5-6 Player Expansion
item.comment: If ever there was a game you should not add more people too, it is this one. Please make it stop.

item.name: The Stars Are Right
item.comment: A chaotic puzzle that leads to too much downtime.

item.name: Starship Catan
item.comment: Very enjoyable 2-player game. Better that the SoC card game, and even better than the Starfareres board game.

item.name: Station Master
item.comment: An interesting train game played with cards. Nice screwage, requires planning, decent production.

item.name: Steam over Holland
item.comment: We had a few rules errors, but I am eager to try again.

item.name: Steam: Rails to Riches
item.comment: Played Pre-release copy

item.name: Steel Driver
item.comment: Very solid release from Martin Wallace. This train game has an action-point auction and shares that pay off at the end of the game. Sold and interesting

item.name: Stephensons Rocket
item.comment: Played first at Games Day 2004 and it was, without a doubt, the highlight of the convention for me. The game was amazing and agonizing and fun and surprising. Incredible. I may increase my rating after a few more plays

item.name: Sticheln
item.comment: Very enjoyable trick-taker. I really love the screwage factor here, which is off the charts.

item.name: Stock Car Championship Racing Card Game
item.comment: With some of the revised rules, the game really improves, but i still feel a complete lack of control with this one.

item.name: Stone Age
item.comment: I was disappointed after 1 play. I hope that the game reveals some hidden depth. If it does, my initial 6 will increase, if not...I must admit, after more plays, it has grown on me. A very enjoyable game. After even more play, it has slipped again. There are much better worker placement options out there.

item.name: Stone Age: Style is the Goal
Das Strrische Muli
item.comment: Cute little race game filler

item.name: La Strada
item.comment: Good connection game, suffers a bit in that, while the game offers many options, with analysis, the game seems to offer very few actual choices.

item.name: Stratego
item.comment: An enjoyable game, still.

item.name: Stratego Legends
item.comment: Fiddlyness and random stuff not really needed.

item.name: Street Illegal
item.comment: Very hard to make a come back, and cards have some elements that are difficult to distinguish. Overall, there are much better race game options out there.

item.name: Street Paintball
item.comment: An excellent speed game.

item.name: Street Soccer
item.comment: One of my favorite 2-player games. Highly tactical, fast-playing, and fun. Great game all around. Components are top-notch.

item.name: Strozzi
item.comment: A very solid successor to Medici. it feels similar, but plays very differently.

item.name: Struggle of Empires
item.comment: I used to claim not to like long games. Die Macher and Struggle show that long games don't have to be boring and repetitive. I felt involved the whole time. I really liked the forced alliance mechanism.

item.name: Subbuteo
item.comment: Very Fun Flicking soccer game that requires a great amount of skill.

item.name: Submarine
item.comment: Well, not that good. Lacking in both fun and the feeling of control.

item.name: Suburbia
item.comment: A very good game of planning and managing growth on 3 areas simultaneously, all while keeping track of various public and private goals.

item.name: Suburbia: Essen SPIEL Expansion
item.comment: A nice addition to the game

item.name: Succession: Intrigue in the Royal Court
item.comment: This game has great production, but really came out very mediocre in the play of the game.

item.name: SuDoku: Das Kartenspiel
item.comment: Not a bad diversion, easy and yet still interesting to play

item.name: Sunda to Sahul
item.comment: I bought this for my wife. We love to play agonizingly slowly. When we play with others, we use the simultaneous play and it speeds up immensely. Great game and so very, very beautiful.

item.name: Survive!
item.comment: Very enjoyable, if somewhat random game. I have discovered that the rulesets are very different. I prefer the US version (men have varying values) to the german (each man is a set number of points).

item.name: Sushi Express
item.comment: Tactical dice game, but with few real decisions to be made each round.

item.name: Sushizock im Gockelwok
item.comment: A more involved and decision-prone version of Heckmeck.

item.name: Sylla
item.comment: There is a lot going on here, and I felt that the game went a bit too long. Still enjoyable, and will be better with repeat plays, i am sure.

item.name: Ta Y
item.comment: Good abstract. High level of interaction. Enjoyable game play and lovely pieces.

item.name: Taboo
item.comment: Truly fun party game. I like Dave Arnott's Scoring variant, and we usually use that.

item.name: Taj Mahal
item.comment: What a great game, the mechanics serve to balance desires and there is no optimal strategy. One of Knizia's best.

item.name: Take it Easy!
item.comment:
Simultaneous solitare puzzles.
BUT, really good simultaneous solitare puzzles.

item.name: Take it to the Limit!
item.comment: Very nice solo puzzle solving game. Can go a bit long.

item.name: Take Stock
item.comment: Played at Prototype at EQ-III. Quite good. Offers a lot of real choices and interesting hand-management decisions.

item.name: Tal der Abenteuer: Die Schatzsuche im Himalaja
item.comment: A cute game, very light, but the Honeybears scoring makes the decisions non-trivial.

item.name: Tales of the Arabian Nights
item.comment: A fun experience, albeit, not entirely fitting within my own definition of a game. A pastime, rather, but a fun one, with a game-like veneer.

item.name: Tally Ho!
item.comment: Good, if somewhat confusing at first, game for 2. Deserves more play, so don't get daunted early on.

item.name: Taluva
item.comment: The graphics are a bit distracting/busy at first, but the gameplay is quite good, and has a good amount of depth to playtime ratio. Deeper strategies become apparent after more play.

item.name: TAMSK
item.comment: Not the best game in the GIPF series, but the unique mechanisms still make it appealing.

item.name: Tante Tarantel
item.comment: Homemade Copy

item.name: Tantrix
item.comment: I am a big sucker for spatial puzzles. I love this one most of all.

item.name: Tanz der Hornochsen!
item.comment: Rated after 2 playings (5 player, and 6 player). Very good game. Feels like 6 Nimmt, which is good, but is more strategic without bogging down. Also good. Good. Cute board and graphics.

item.name: Tarot
item.comment: I Own 2 Tarot Decks: An Aquarian Tarot (Stickered for Zarcana) and an Art Nouveau Tarot (Stickered for Gnostica). I only use those decks for those games...

item.name: Tears of the Dragon
item.comment: Only one play, but the game was ok. The person I played with (who won) enjoyed it quite a bit less than I did, however.

item.name: Techno Witches
item.comment: Very fun and light race game with multiple scenarios. Has shades of RoboRally in the programmed movement, but plays much faster and with a lot less hassle.

item.name: Telestrations
item.comment: A cute party game that lasts too long

item.name: Templar Queenie 1: The Messages & The Coins
Templar Queenie 2: The Secret Letters, The Tapestries & The Lamps
Tempus
item.comment: Not really a civ game, but a very good building game.

item.name: Terra Mystica
item.comment: After 8 plays, using 7 different races, the game feels wonderfully balanced. This is a tense and tight game of resource management and building that, despite some rather abstract mechanics and pieces, has a feel that fits the theme very well. An excellent design.

item.name: Terra Mystica: Bonus Card Shipping Value
Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents
Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents Bonus Luminaries
Tesla vs. Edison: War of Currents Bonus Luminaries
The Fishermen of Catan
item.originalname: The Settlers of Catan: The Fishermen of Catan
item.conditiontext:
Still in shrink (2 copies)
Not in shrink, unpunched (1 copy)

item.name: The Infinite Board Game
item.comment: Rating is based on the value and idea of the system as a whole. Some games are good, many are marginal, a few are excellent.

item.name: The Three Commandments
item.comment: An excellent marriage of party game and inductive reasoning game. Fun and silly with the right crowd.

item.name: Thebes
item.comment:
Light, fun , engaging. Excellent mechanisms. Always Play With Mik Svellov's Variant (remove 1 dirt tile per dig). Good googly-moogly, the bits in this game are nice.
Just let me start by saying, that the luck of the game doesn't bother me.
The main reason I play games is to have fun, and part of that fun can be matching wits with other players, but a large part of it can also be matching wits with the game engine itself. This is why games like Shadows over Camelot and Lord of the Rings are fun - they setup difficult tasks that take planning, execution, timing, and luck to overcome. Jenseits is not a cooperative game, but like a cooperative game, much of the fun from the game comes from doing well in spite of the obstacles in front of you. In JvT, those obstacles most often take the form of some measure of bad luck.
I wouldn't want to play games like JvT all the time, as it can get rather frustrating fighting that uphill battle too often, but if I am in the right mood for it, a fun game like JvT is right up my alley.

item.name: Thin Ice
item.comment: Great fun, and just what the doctor ordered for those IceHouse pieces. Everyone wants to play it as soon as they grab the pieces anyway.

item.name: This Town Ain't Big Enough for the 2-4 of Us
Three-Dragon Ante
item.comment: This type of game works best with actual money on the line. there is little control, and the gameplay can become plodding.

item.name: Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Through the Desert
item.comment: I guess I don't find it as dry as most do. I love this game.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis
item.comment: A nice game, plays in about 45 minutes and reminds me in many ways of TTR, Web of Power, and Showmanager. Theme is unique, and the gameplay reminds one of some of the early Rails games from Martin Wallace. Excellent choice for a medium to light weight opener.

item.name: Thurn and Taxis: Power and Glory
item.comment: I liked the decisions, and the timing issues, as well as the ability to "hide" cards. Much better than the original. Better even than the original with the spielbox expansion.

item.name: Thurn und Taxis: Der Kurier der Frstin
item.comment: I really enjoy the additional thinking this brings to the game. Very worth it!

item.name: Tichu
item.comment: Tichu is a dangerous game. You will play it once, think it is OK, and wonder what the fuss is about. You will play again to see what you might have missed, and you won't see it. Then... you play again, you start to see it... it starts coming together. Suddenly, you are in love, you play it like crazy. You want to play it over and over and over again. You dream about it, you imagine how you can replay a hand, you dream of playing the game. It might just be the perfect card game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride
item.comment: I find it amazingly fun, fast to learn, and beautifully produced. After many, many, plays, it just keeps getting better and better.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 1 Team Asia & Legendary Asia
item.comment: I love the team aspect; it really re-invigorated TTR for me.

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 2 India & Switzerland
item.comment: Swiss map is a great one for 3 players. Not played India yet, so rating may change

item.name: Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 3 The Heart of Africa
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 4 Nederland
Ticket to Ride Map Collection: Volume 5 United Kingdom & Pennsylvania
item.comment: Played only Pennsy so far, and I found it very engaging and interesting. This may revive TTR as much as the partnership Asia game did. Kudos, Mr. Moon!

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europa 1912
item.comment: Ticket variety adds interest.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Europe
item.comment: A sequel that improves on the original in some ways, but harms it in others. Ultimately less satisfying than the original, though still a very good game.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mrklin
item.comment: A bit more complex, and much higher scoring. Excellent game, rating may go up after more plays.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Mystery Train Expansion
item.comment: The new tickets do a lot to make the game better, they offer incentive to draw tickets, they offer ways of getting ahead when you fall behind, and they help the players in the back of the pack more than the front. Succeeds at the goal of making T2R better, which is hard to do (because it is so good).

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Nordic Countries
item.comment: A very good 3-player map. Tough, confining, interesting.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: Switzerland
item.comment: Great addition to the game. I really enjoy the new types of tickets.
item.conditiontext: The version I have is a wood-mounted board handmade by Jesse McGrath, and signed by both him and Alan Moon. I also have the commercial version.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Card Game
item.comment: How does one make a card game from TTR? Well, amazingly, if you do it right, you make a game that retains some of the feel of the original, but add some take-that and some new goals to get a game that can stand on it's own.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: The Dice Expansion
item.comment: Not at all what was needed.

item.name: Ticket to Ride: USA 1910
item.comment: Gives the original new life. excellent production.

item.name: Tier auf Tier
item.comment: A cute and fun filler.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: Enjoyable game with a lot to offer. Very intense. I own the Mayfair version.

item.name: Tigris & Euphrates
item.comment: A tense game with excellent mechanics, one that will stand the test of time.

item.name: Tikal
item.comment: Great game. Suffers a bit in the length when you play with those who have trouble reaching decisions.

item.name: Tiki Topple
item.comment: Decent Filler, not a lot of depth, but quick to play and easy to learn, with excellent bits.

item.name: Timber Tom
item.comment: Good-googly-moogly. There is no frakking way this dude is making money on this game. Wow, these components are amazing.

item.name: Time is Money
item.comment:
I was really surprised at how much I liked this game. Having to count the time as you go, as well as figuring out what money to grab, makes for a lot of silly fun.
Acquired in a BGG Trade (Gang of Four), with Tom Ireland (nhtommypop).

item.name: Time's Up!
item.comment: Probably my favorite party game. Loads o' fun. More fun than steroid-craving monkeys wielding lightsaber pez dispensers.

item.name: Time's Up! Deluxe
item.comment: Some of the best cards from the prior game and it's 2 expansions. In a better (more appropriate) sized box.

item.name: Time's Up! Expansion set #1
item.comment: Good addition to a good game.

item.name: Time's Up! Expansion set #2
item.comment: Another good addition to a good game.

item.name: Time's Up! Title Recall!
item.comment: Not quite as good as the base game, as some people simply aren't going to get titles of albums or Broadway plays. Still, part of that frustration is what makes this game...

item.name: Timeline: Historical Events
item.comment: Unremarkable as a game. Likely a better history teaching aid than a game.

item.name: Times Square
item.comment: Really not that much going on here. Dull.

item.name: Tinners' Trail
item.comment: An excellent game with a lot to think about and do. One of Wallace's most approachable designs.

item.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Satellites & Super Weapons Mini Expansion
Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Kickstarter Deluxe Content
To Court the King
item.comment: Luck-filled, but still great terrific, filler game. Don't play with 5 - 4 max.

item.name: Tokaido
item.comment: The game plays you. You have 2 essential options: take the furthest-back spot and gain three points, or jump ahead and maybe get 1 extra point, but watch your opponents get multiple turns to your one. Not worth playing again.

item.name: Toledo
item.comment: I think I liked this more than my opponents did. I thought the combat system was unique and fun, and that the deployment of buildings was interesting. Overall, I thought it very good.

item.name: Tombouctou
item.comment: Excellent Deduction/bluffing/memory/set collection game.

item.name: Tongiaki
item.comment: Too many players causes you to lose control too quickly, and there is a definite rich-get-richer issue, but the game is fun and it's mechanics are intriguing.

item.name: Top Secret Spies
item.comment: This game has surprising depth. I enjoy it with the TS cards and the Secret Dossiers variants best.

item.name: Toppo
item.comment: Uninspiring.

item.name: Torres
item.comment: Deep and thinky. I need more play to codify my opinions, but it has a strong likelihood of getting better.

item.name: Toscana
item.comment: Not unpleasant, but not a lot of real choices. The optimal plays were obvious. Pretty game, though.

item.name: Tower of Babel
item.comment: I seemed to like this much more than most of the others I saw playing it. I liked the multiple scoring options, and the mechanics, while dry, seemed solid. The board is a little unclear on regions, but the game is quite enjoyable.

item.name: Traders of Carthage
item.comment: Interesting game with some nice interaction of it's mechanisms and some tough decision making.

item.name: The Traders of Genoa
item.comment: Best with 5, if you avoid playing with over-analyzers.

item.name: Traditional Card Games
item.comment: A standard deck of cards is the most important and versatile gaming implement known.

item.name: Trans Europa
item.comment: If possible, I liked this less than the original. Some cities are just always worse, no matter what your other cards are. Seems horribly unfair.

item.name: TransAmerica
item.comment: Decent, fast, light, not terrible.

item.name: Travel Blokus
item.comment:
The closer start forces some early agression -- which is a good thing!
I always lose, but I enjoy the game so much, I rarely care.

item.name: Travel Scrabble
item.comment: The small components annoy, but it is still Scrabble.

item.name: Trax
item.comment: 2 Sets... Lovely path game

item.name: Trax
item.comment: Excellent connection game.

item.name: Treasure Chest
item.comment: A collection of small expansions and promos. Nice to give some good older games an excuse to return to play.

item.name: Treehouse
item.comment: A little too chaotic, but not bad.

item.name: Tri-Ominos
item.comment: A Fun Variation on a classic game

item.name: Trias
item.comment: A good game, but plays a bit too slowly.

item.name: Tribune: Primus Inter Pares
item.comment:
An excellent game with a lot going on. It will take more plays to decide if the Vestal Virgin Leader is a deal-breaker, but right now, I suspect it is not...
A very good take on the worker-placement mechanism we have all embraced of late.

item.name: Triple Yahtzee
item.comment: Had this as a kid. Better than Yahtzee in terms of strategy. But too damn long.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit
item.comment: A mensa quiz hidden in a game.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: Genus IV
item.comment: A mensa quiz hidden in a game.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: The 1980's
item.comment: A mensa quiz hidden in a game.

item.name: Trivial Pursuit: The Lord of the Rings Movie Trilogy Collector's Edition
item.comment: A gift for christmas. Nice bits, theme is weak. Plays just like all the other TP games.

item.name: Trouble
item.comment: No control.

item.name: Trump: The Game
item.comment: Probably the best $5 I spent at Toys R Us. The game was surprisingly better than expected.

item.name: Tsuro
item.comment: Interesting Tile-Laying game. The game looks similar to Metro/Iron Horse in that each tile has paths that intertwine. The goal is very different, however. Each player has a marker, and must place their tile so that they can move their marker. After placing the tile, the marker is moved and another tile drawn. This continues until someone is forced to move off of the game board. This player is eliminated, and play continues until there is only one player left. The components are very nice, with beautiful artwork.

item.name: Tumblin-Dice
item.comment: Very fun dexterity game

item.name: Tunebaya
item.comment: Nice bits, but not as good a game as Hossa, from which it appears to be copied.

item.name: Turbo Taxi
item.comment: Wonderful little speed-spatial relationship game. Anyone who likes Richochet Robot or Take it Easy would like this.

item.name: Tuscany: Expand the World of Viticulture
Twilight Imperium (Third Edition)
item.comment:
Played 2 turns of a game to get a feel for it, and then played a full game. With a break for dinner, this took us from 2pm until midnight, with 6 players who had never played before.
I had a great time. There is a lot of luck, and some of your choices are dictated by your race/action cards, but this is a great game. Player elimination could happen, but it is sufficiently rare that I can't see it happening more than once in 100 games.
My rating is a little off if you go strictly by what BGG defines them as, simply because I don't frequently have this much time to devote to one game. When I do though, this game will be the choice.

item.name: Twilight Imperium (Third Edition): Shattered Empire
item.comment: Essential.

item.name: Twilight Struggle
item.comment: A very enjoyable game of not-war. the game is long, but not overly so for me, and the theming is heavy. I look forward to playing again soon!

item.name: Twister
item.comment: Better played by young, horny singles. Then it goes up to a 10. Before that age, or after marriage, it goes back to a 4.

item.name: Twistgammon
item.comment: Decent backgammon variant.

item.name: Twixt
item.comment: Great connection game. Very challenging. My copy is in shitty condition; I wish more ebayers would be completely honest in their descriptions.

item.name: Typo
item.comment: 6 nimmt with words. Very fun, and better than it sounds

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar
item.comment:
Hoo-ah!
I like the additional planning the mechanism here requires.

item.name: Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar Mini Expansion 1
Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar Mini Expansion 2
Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar Tribes & Prophecies
Tzolk'in: The Mayan Calendar Tribes & Prophecies Mini Expansion 1
Ubongo
item.comment: Ignore the board, just pull two gems for each player in the game and give players gem choices in order of finish. The game is terrificly fun, and can drive you to drink.

item.name: Ubongo Extreme
item.comment: Too extreme

item.name: Ultimate Golf
item.comment: Not a lot of game here, but it sure is purty.

item.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Deluxe Edition For Kickstarter
Ultimate Werewolf: Ultimate Edition
item.comment: Excellent production values and a fantastic ruleset make this THE version of WW to get.

item.name: Ultimate Werewolf: Whitebox Edition
item.comment: Excellent, high quality werewolf set with plenty of extras and amenities

item.name: Um El Bagara
item.comment: It looks like Mancala, but the strategy in play is very different.

item.name: Um Reifenbreite
item.comment:
10th Anniversary Edition.
Excellent race game, one of the best.

item.name: Unexploded Cow
item.comment: Fun, light litle game. Random, but good strategy pays off.

item.name: The Ungame
item.comment: I played this a couple times when I was a kid. It was all part of a plan by the youth minister at my church to bring me out of my shell and get me integrated with the other kids in the church (I was a bit standoffish). It failed miserably.

item.name: Union Pacific
item.comment: I don't get the comparisons to Acquire, as it has a much more cutthroat feel to it, for me. the brinkmanship and tension is wonderfully awful.

item.name: UNO
item.comment: Not entirely horrible, but close.

item.name: Unpublished Prototype
item.comment: Rating and comment are there to make this stop showing up on my "Played and Unrated" and "Played and Uncommented" lists...
item.conditiontext: There are several unpublished prototypes in my collection... Dominion, Power Grid Korea, and Hexamorph just to name a few...

item.name: Unpublished Prototype
item.comment: Rated so that it will stop appearing in my Played and Unrated list.

item.name: Uptown
item.comment: Clever and fun, a very good abstract game with nice production and fun/fast gameplay.

item.name: Upwords
item.comment: Not horrible, but why play this when you could play Scrabble instead? Strategies are too obvious and the game is altogether too easy.

item.name: Uruk: Wiege der Zivilisation
item.comment: THis game lasted a bit long on the table, but it was different and engaging most of the time playing it.

item.name: Vampire
item.comment: Surprisingly good game that kids can understand, and adults can enjoy. There are some good decision points, and the game, while lucky, is not too unbalanced.

item.name: Vanished Planet
item.comment: Very enjoyable cooperative game. I thought it very well-balanced and it was refreshing to work as a team against the game.

item.name: Vanished Planet: Racial Advantage Expansion
item.comment: Played with racial advantages every time I played. I had no idea it was an expansion. I see no reason not to use this.

item.name: Vasco da Gama
item.comment: A non unpleasant trip into Yet Another Cube Pusher Land. Little to repulse you, but uncompelling in the same way.

item.name: Vegas Showdown
item.comment:
Interesting building game. The choice of Vegas Hotels was arbitrary, probably to jump on the Poker bandwagon, but the game really is quite good, light, family fare.
WTB New Edition

item.name: Vegas Showdown
item.comment: WTB new version for the new boards...

item.name: Velo City
item.comment: A good race game with some team elements that control the strategy. Very nice.

item.name: Venezia
item.comment: Enjoyable game of area control. Great theme. Play was tight, and the powers, while not balanced, are balancable by the fact that the more popular ones may not get to be executed if two people select them on the same turn.

item.name: Venture
item.comment: Very deep and advanced for such a light-looking little card game. I want to play it more. This game shows why Sid Sackson was such a genius. Many of the mechanisms in this game have found their way into modern designer games, where those same mechanics were lauded and labelled "new" or "innovative".

item.name: Verflixxt nochmal
item.comment: I really enjoy this with more players, so the new pawns are terrific, and the optional rules are great.

item.name: Verflixxt!
item.comment: A nice game of strategy and forethought with a bit of luck thrown in for good measure. The game has nice bits, oddly intriguing artwork, and quick gameplay with 3-minute rules.

item.name: The Very Clever Pipe Game
item.comment: A great tile-laying game disguised as a card game. Probably Cheapass's best.

item.name: Vexation
item.comment: Own 2 copies, i keep one in each Trans... box. really helps up the game-factor of the games-that-aren't.

item.name: Victory & Honor
item.comment: Very playable and innovative trick-taking game. Must have exactly 4 players, but the game is deep, offering many options and chances for a change in tactics.

item.name: Vikings
item.comment:
Played only the basic game. I enjoyed it but felt it was lacking some control. i would like to try the advanced rules before rendering a full judgment.
Update: I really, really prefer the advanced game. Much more "game" there...

item.name: Villa Paletti
item.comment: Very fun and eye-catching. Great game for adults and kids.

item.name: Village
item.comment: A really good worker placement game, with the twist being that your workers can die >urk

item.name: Village: Customer Expansion
item.comment: Worth getting for the variety.

item.name: Vino
item.comment: Interesting merger between an area control and a stock market game. Quite pleasant, tense, and strategic. Many opportunities for the ole screwgie.

item.name: Viva Pamplona!
item.comment: Great fun. Must play with badda accentas. Ita maka da game. You a coward if you over here.

item.name: Volcano
item.comment: Very enjoyable. Good solitaire activity. I have both Kadon boards, and play it solitaire more often than not.

item.name: Volldampf
item.comment: A terrific game, though it has been superseded in complexity and enjoyment by both AoS and Railroad Tycoon.

item.name: Volle Wolle
item.comment: Terrific little dice game with some tough choices and a cute theme. excellent game to play with kids.

item.name: Voltage
item.comment: Very reminiscent of Balloon Cup. High production values. A little less control than i would have liked...

item.name: Vom Kap bis Kairo
item.comment: Decent, if not great game. Left me a bit flat.

item.name: Wabash Cannonball
item.comment: Excellent medium weight train game. there is not "pickup and deliver", but the share system and the many tiny but agonizing decisions make this a winner.

item.name: Wabash Cannonball: Erie Railroad expansion
item.originalname: Chicago Express: Narrow Gauge & Erie Railroad Company

item.name: Wabash Cannonball: Narrow Gauge Expansion
item.originalname: Chicago Express: Narrow Gauge & Erie Railroad Company

item.name: Walk the Dogs
item.comment:
I liked the game for what it was. Played our third game with a rule that was supposedly Alan's original rule, and my rating is based on playing with that rule (below) as it makes the game much better.
Each player is dealt 4 cards. Every turn, a player may either draw or play a card, and may never have more than four cards. So, the first time around, everyone plays a card and takes dogs; after that, it's Decision time. I like what this simple tweak adds to this simple game.

item.name: Wallamoppi
item.comment: Decent but not spectacular dex game.

item.name: Wallenstein (first edition)
item.comment: A great game with a near perfect balance between building, conflict, and careful planning. I like that, as a war game, it makes you think about building and feeding people, and that as a building game, it makes you think about conflict.

item.name: War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment: Long gameplay, and the rules are daunting. A very good game, however, so make the effort to play.

item.name: Warriors
item.comment: I guess it just wasn't for me.

item.name: Warriors: Dragon Hordes Expansion
item.comment: A little, i don't know, repetitive, bland, been-there-done-that. Yeah, all that stuff.

item.name: Was sticht?
item.comment: Masterful trick-taking game with unique scoring mechanism.

item.name: Wasabi!
item.comment: A fun little tile-laying game with some great gotcha moments, and amazing components.

item.name: Waterworks
item.comment: This game plays best when played fast. We try to complete each play/draw combo in under 2 seconds. Speed WaterWorks.

item.name: We Didn't Playtest This At All
Die Weinhndler
item.comment: Excellent set collecting and hand management game. Great theme. I really enjoyed it.

item.name: Wench
item.comment: Not to be taken too seriously, and a fairly decent light filler.

item.name: The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow
item.comment: Great game for 8 , a lot of fun in the right group. Try not to make me moderate all night long

item.name: The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: The Village
Wettstreit der Baumeister
item.comment: Very nice game of auctions and bidding, with a building theme. I really enjoyed it.

item.name: Whacky Wit
item.comment:
#000120
A lot of fun, well balanced, not a total luck fest. And even better, its play is such a part of the cultural zeitgeist you almost need not explain how to play.
And the chipmunk factor is off the charts.

item.name: What Were You Thinking?
item.comment: Way fun, but only when you play the "list 5 things" questions, and best when you make up your own of those.

item.name: Who's the Ass?
item.comment: Fun card game filler. Nice change of pass, and appropriately gotcha but not too much so that players will not usually refuse to play again.

item.name: Why Did the Chicken...?
item.comment: Great Party game. Surpasses A2A for fun and pure "laugh factor". Much more intelligent than most party game fare.

item.name: WildLife
item.comment: High level of player interaction, very engaging gameplay. Excellent game.

item.name: Win, Lose, or Banana
item.comment: 10-pack

item.name: Winds Of Plunder
item.comment: Very enjoyable game of strategy and planning. Careful thought is rewarded, and there are multiple way to try to achieve victory.

item.name: Wings of War: Burning Drachens
item.comment: WooHoo, blimps! Great expansion. A must have for fans of the game. Adds lots of planes and most importantly, altitude rules and ground emplacements.

item.name: Wings of War: Dawn of War
item.originalname: Wings of War: The Dawn of World War II

item.name: Wings of War: Famous Aces
item.comment: Very fun and quick-playing game of slow planes in aerial combat. Very evocative of the theme. Great graphics and it all really worked for me. I think the best part was that the game was not reliant on many random factors, and the strategy of combat was up to you.

item.name: Wings of War: Recon Patrol Booster Pack
item.comment: More planes and maneuver decks, Boo-Yah!

item.name: Wings of War: Top Fighters Booster Pack
item.comment: More planes and maneuver decks, Boo-Yah!

item.name: Wings of War: Watch Your Back!
item.comment: Very fun and quick-playing game of slow planes in aerial combat. Very evocative of the theme. Great graphics and it all really worked for me. I think the best part was that the game was not reliant on many random factors, and the strategy of combat was up to you.

item.name: Winner's Circle
item.comment: Excellent game. Good bluffing ability, excellent play, nice bits. Another Knizia winner.

item.name: Witch's Brew
item.comment:
An interesting game where you have to hope to avoid others taking the same action you have, and to choose carefully what to do when you have taken the same action as another.
I highly suspect that this game, like Adel Verpflichtet, is best with more players.

item.name: Wits & Wagers
item.comment:
I first played this over a year ago, in a prototype form, at EuroQuest II, with the designers and a bunch of other people. We all had a great time.
I bought it this year, at EQ III, and we first played the finished version over the Thanksgiving holiday. It was a great deal of fun, and even those in our group who dislike party games and trivia games thought it was a lot of fun.
I have played in a couple of the Wits & Wagers events that Dominic & crew run at conventions. they really make the game fun, and having multiple-person teams really helps make the game even more fun.
Dominic should come packaged in the box. ;)
Dominic is a friend, though I believe my rating is not unduly influenced by that. He's a great guy who has made a great game that everyone i have played it with enjoys.

item.name: Wiz-War
item.comment: Not my game, but i can see the appeal. I suppose if I had less good memories of D&D this would seem better, but alas, it falls flat.

item.name: Wizard Jubilumsedition
item.comment: Not a bad trick-taking game. The estimation phase is especially tense and fraught with angst.

item.name: Wongar
item.comment: Interesting take on area control. Game has a lot going on, and almost too much control (the extra scoring cards meant you were almost never unable to do exactly what you wanted, much less something beneficial.

item.name: Wooden Ships & Iron Men
item.comment: A fun, if long, way to spend a day. Best played in teams. Seems to simulate well the warfare of the period.

item.name: Wooly Bully
item.comment: A good tile-laying game, but nothing too exciting or different here.

item.name: Word on the Street
item.comment: A light party word game. If that description appeals to you, you will like this, if your first reaction was WTF? then stay far away.

item.name: Wordwild
item.comment: Fun and light word game with speed elements. i dunno, not really my type of game, but we did laugh the whole time we played.

item.name: Worm Up!
item.comment: A predictive guessing game, with big prizes for the lucky, and a racing game strapped in for good measure.

item.name: The Worst-Case Scenario Survival Game
item.comment: Is there a game in there?

item.name: Wyatt Earp
item.comment: A surprisingly fun game. Plays best with 3, as I am sure others have mentioned. A nice variation on standard Rummy.

item.name: Yahtzee
item.comment: Everyone knows this. What is there to say?

item.name: YINSH
item.comment: My favorite of the Gipf series.

item.name: You Must Be an Idiot!
item.comment: Played several times. A fun combination of bluffing and trivia.

item.name: You're Bluffing!
item.comment:
I have the "You're Bluffing!" version...
Very good Filler. Among the top 5 fillers, I think...

item.name: Ys
item.comment:
Played once. I am not a fan of blind bidding. I have a hard time deciding what to write here, the game seemed almost themeless, and it had blind bidding which I usually hate, but I feel that I would play it again. I am not sure I would play it a lot, however. My rating is quite tenuous and will likely change if I get the chance to play again soon.
Update: Played again. It didn't get any better. I changed my rating to a 5. Not very pleasant.
Update: Played again. Still not great, but not terrible. I just can't stand the blind mechanic.

item.name: Yspahan
item.comment:
A terrific game where the dice don't really overwhelm with luck, and a good strategy can easily take the day. Another winner for Ystari.
May have a single strategy problem.

item.name: Ystari Box
item.comment: A collection of small expansions and promos. Nice to give some good older games an excuse to return to play.

item.name: Zagami
item.comment: Odd ruleset. takes a bit to wrap your haed around.

item.name: Zendo
item.comment: Engaging and fun. A real treat of reasoning.

item.name: ZRTZ
item.comment: The Gipf series has forced me to rethink my stance on abstracts in general. This one is probably the best-looking of the series, and second only to YINSH in gameplay.

item.name: Ziegen Kriegen
item.comment: A fun little filler of a game with some definite strategy going on...

item.name: Zig-Zag
item.comment: Fast filler: speed and memory elements, so beware if those give you pause.

item.name: Zirkus Flohcati
item.comment: Good fast playing filler game.

item.name: Zitternix
item.comment: Cute, a nice little dex game.

item.name: Zoff in Buffalo
item.comment: Fun simultaneous game with cows! excellent mechanism for balancing based on number of players.

item.name: Zombie Fluxx
item.comment: About what you expect, though the zombie killing mechanisms are fun and more strategic than might be expected.

item.name: Zombie Fluxx Flame-Thrower Expansion Pack
item.comment: Cute and fun addition. Burn, baby, burn!

item.name: Zombie Fluxx: Larry the Zombie Promo Card
Zombies!!!
item.comment: Plays just a little long. Has some great "gotcha" moments. there really is more game here than I was expecting. I was expecting to give the game a 2 or 3, but it wasn't that bad.

item.name: Zombies!!! 2: Zombie Corps(e)
item.comment: All the extra stuff just makes the game a little too tedious. Keep it simple, and fast.

item.name: Zombies!!! 3.5: Not Dead Yet
item.comment: Starting to get really long now.

item.name: Zombies!!! 3: Mall Walkers
item.comment: Now we've gone round the bend. Too much of a bad thing.

item.name: Zombies!!! 4: The End...
item.comment: Better than the previous expansions, just for the new in-game jokes you can make with the little zombie puppies.

item.name: Zooloretto
item.comment: A better upgrade to the basic Coloretto engine than I gave it credit for originally. It is growing on me, especially when played with the expansions.

item.name: Zooloretto Erweiterung (Abacusspiele Katalog)
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto XXL
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Erweiterung Der Eisbr
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Erweiterung Drei Extragehege
item.comment: A nice little set of boards. Completely optional, but nice to have.

item.name: Zooloretto: Erweiterung Wanderbaustellen
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Grizzly
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #1
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Rio Grande Games Expansion Pack #2
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: The Gorilla
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: The Petting Zoo
item.comment: This is an excellent expansion, achieving well the goal of increasing the money in the game, while also adding to the number of choices. A very good thing.

item.name: Zooloretto: The Savings Book
item.comment: These little expansions make a nice bonus, but aren't necessary.

item.name: Zooloretto: Three Additional Buildings
item.comment: Not as necessary as the Petting Zoo Expansion, but a nice trio of effects/options/ideas. Very clever.

item.name: Zwergen Ziehen
item.comment: Fun little game. Reminds one of Duell a bit whilst playing.
